Naseem is hopeful that her son's business will be well established after investing in it, and her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living as a result.

loans.use: to buy edible items to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail business, selling khangas at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Khangas are traditional wrap-around garments. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business. Alice dreams of establishing a shop to sell khangas in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of khangas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of khangas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase computers to sell

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking fat, oil and wheat flour. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, cooking fat, oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Khayrulo

texts.ru: Хайруло житель города Кургантюбе. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его семья является одним из самой прославленой семей в городе. Они славятся тем, что изготавливают хорошие калибельни (говара) и национальные посуды (табаки чуби) из дерево. Их работа является ручной. Хайруло хочет взять кредит для покупки сырья, то есть досок.
texts.en: Khayrulo is a resident of Qurgan-Tube.  He is forty years old, married, and has four children.  His family is one of the most renown families in the city. They are famous for making good cradles (govara) and traditional dishware (tabaki chubi) from wood. Their work is hand made.  Khayrulo wants to take out a loan to buy raw materials, i.e. boards.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, i.e. boards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a generator and projector

loans.name: Nonjabulo Group

texts.en:
Zonke is 53 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 11 and 32, only one of whom attends school. She runs a clothing business  in Empangeni in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand. 

She has been in this business for two years selling clothes from door to door. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. Zonke requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her and her family's lives and hopes that WDB and Kiva will make it possible. She faces the challenge of customers who buy on credit and fail to pay back. In future she would like to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Nyamwegabirwa Twetungure Group

texts.en: Ruth, aged 49 years, is one hardworking lady who is very partial to the philosophy of thinking outside the box. The happily married mother of four banked on her creative ideas to set forth in her retail business a decade ago in Kihihi. Back then, Ruth used to cherish the phrase "Nothing ventured, nothing gained". It was her courage of conviction and tempting fate attitude that was behind the decision to try this business. Through the 10 years, Ruth has learned the tricks and nitty gritty of retail trading. It is the sole reason she says why her business is still carving out a stronger niche. Ruth says she used her savings to get established. She is a primary school teacher in her home area. She says this business generates her 90,000 shillings sale profits weekly. The purpose of this loan she says is to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a great mom with four grown children. She has invested much of her life in her most precious endeavor, raising her children. However, she has always successfully balanced work and family without any damage to either. That has probably been one the secrets of her success. Guldasta launched her own venture 14 years ago. She is a very reliable client and has been prompt with all her payments to IMON International, never having a late payment. Today, Guldasta’s business provides a stable source of income and security in life. She is hoping to continue keeping this business stable. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS to construct a vending kiosk and increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for retail sale in her stand. She hopes to keep her business running and bringing her a profit in the future as well.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, to epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To construct a vending kiosk and to purchase women's national clothing for resale

loans.name: Rajabmoh

texts.en:
Rajabmoh is married with four children. She sells women's national clothing in one of the largest local markets. She can boast a wide assortment of inventory, flexible pricing policy and loyal clientele. She started this business 13 years ago. Rajabmoh is seeking a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase seasonal clothing for further retail sales in her kiosks. She hopes this loan will help her expand and boost her sales. We believe Rajabmoh’s natural ability to think through what is most essential, and to make quick and wise decisions, will help her succeed and repay the current loan promptly.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase women's national clothing to sell

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Janil is a 46-year old entrepreneur from Bint Jbeil, who is married and has one child. He has been renting a grocery store for the past 28 years, which has given him wide experience in this industry. His customers include neighbors, friends and other community members. Janil believes that it is high quality work and experience that have helped him succeed.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua; his previous loan had a big positive effect on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower of good standing. He plans to use the loan to improve his quality of work, through buying new summer products and doing some maintenance to his shop.

loans.use: to buy new summer products and to do some maintenance to his shop

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Наргиз проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ей 42 гда. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама Наргиз имеет средне - специальное образование, портниха. На сегодняшний день она не занимается по специальности. Она занимается торговлей на рынке центральном рынке города. В основном она продает золотые украшения. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов золотых украшений, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Nargiz lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 42 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is in the Russian Federation. Nargiz has a vocational education as a dressmaker. She does not work in her profession. She trades in the city's central market. Basically she sells gold jewelry. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of gold jewelry to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of gold jewelry

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 32-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has two children. He has been working in construction as a house painter for the past 10 years, which has given him wide experience in this industry. His customers include friends and other community members. Mouhamad says that he is very proud of his quality of work and believes that his extensive experience is what distinguishes him.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This will be his third loan from Al Majmoua; his previous loan had a big positive effect on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower of good standing. He plans to use the loan to buy necessary tools for his business and to fix his house tiles.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business and to fix his house tiles

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a market entrepreneur from Kumsangir, Tajikistan. She sells clothing in the city market and has been in this business for 15 years. She was forced to find ways to survive and earn her living which is why she launched this business. Firuza is seeking a loan of 7,500 TJS to increase her capital so she can purchase women's national clothing to sell. She is hoping to press on with her expansion plans and ultimately save enough to open a new vending facility in the future. We believe Firuza’s enterprising spirit will help her achieve all her goals and see her dreams come true.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase women's national clothing to sell

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en:
Nabih is a 26-year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is single. He has been working for the past three years selling car accessories and hookas (an oriental tobacco pipe with a long, flexible tube that draws the smoke through water contained in a bowl). This has given him wide experience in this industry. His customers include neighbors, friends and other community members. Nabih says that he is very passionate about his work and that he could not imagine a life without it.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This will be his third loan from Al Majmoua; his previous loans had a big positive effect on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower of good standing. He plans to use the loan to buy a bobcat for lifting heavy products and accessories from one place to another and he might also rent it to constructors.

loans.use: To buy a bobcat for lifting heavy products

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Bashiran is involved in a business sewing clothes. She runs her business from home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. Her clientele base is her neighbors. She receives orders from them and earns good profit after completing orders on time. She has been doing this business for the past many years and has a good reputation among her clients. She can sew designer and non-designer dresses easily. She charges from Pak rupees 180 to Pak rupees 200 for a single dress. Her earnings allow her to manage the household expenses. 

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to further improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is not producing quality work and takes a long time to sew a single dress. She hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her household income. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Bashiran.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Manhal

texts.en:
ManhA., a 30-year old unmarriied entrepreneur from Lebanon, has operated an auto repair service for the past six years ago. His 14 years of experience in the field have enabled him to provide high-quality service, and he counts among his many customers friends and other community members.

ManhA. is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy tools necessary for his business. He hopes to expand his work and improve all of his machines.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his business.

loans.name: Mahmanabi

texts.ru: Махманаби проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Махманаби занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 16 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Mahmanabi lives in Bohtar. He is 53 years old, married, and has four children. His wife keeps house. Mahmanabi is a farmer. He grows vegetables and wheat. He also works in animal husbandry.  He raises cattle for sale. He has been doing this work for more than sixteen years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sigismond

texts.en:
Sigismond is 26 years old and is married with one child, aged one.  He runs a distributor store for a brewery and for soft drinks in Aberdeen, the western part of Freetown.

Sigismond has owned this business for five years and sells soft drinks, wine and beer at his store. He also receives income from his elder brother who lives overseas. He says that the main challenge to his business is during the rainy season, when sales are much slower compared to the dry season.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soft drinks, beer, Heineken and clean water. Sigismond says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living and increase his capital. In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drink, beer and clean water

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.es:
La señora Mercedez de 47 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo varón, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, jugos y terere de forma ambulante de hace más de 13 años en la terminal de ómnibus de la ciudad.
Desde muy joven le gusto el tema de las ventas, ella comenta que con mucho esfuerzo está logrando tener todas la comodidades en su pequeño hogar, actualmente con la buena venta que realiza ya tiene otros ideales como de contar con una casilla de ventas con mas mercaderías.
La Sra. se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella no teme al trabajo y esta segura de que con la ayuda del prestamo podra cumplir muchas de sus espectativas.
Solicita el crédito para poder cumplir su sueño y mediante esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedez, 47, is a single mother and has a son.  She has been a street vendor for over 13 years in the omnibus terminal where she sells sweets, juices and tereré (a type of tea).

She has always been interested in sales from the time she was very young.  With a lot of effort she is able to have all the comforts in her small home.  With sales going well now she is thinking of other projects such as owning her own stall where she can sell more merchandise.

Mercedez defines herself as hard-working and a fighter.  She is not afraid of work and is sure that with the help of the loan she will be able to meet her goals.  She is requesting a loan to reach this goal and improve family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy sweets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the travel expenses to Jordan to visit her sick sister.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Sonia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Gabriel con 35 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 2 Hijos, menores de edad.
Posee una Despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señora muy trabajadora, exelente cliente con Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella manifiesta que desde pequeña ha trabajo y no teme a hacer cualquier tipo de trabajo. Sueña con poder tener una gran despensa donde poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos.
Solicita el crédito para poder abastecer el stock de mercaderias de su local. Quiere poder ampliar la variedad de sus productos, pues sabe que teniendo mas variedad podria atraer mas clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia is from from the city of Santaní.  She is 36 and married to Mr. Gabriel, age 35.  They have two minor children.  She has a grocery store set up in her home with and an established customer base, and a good income.  She has good commercial and personal references, is a hard worker and an excellent customer of the Paraguaya Foundation.

From a very young age she has always worked and is not afraid to take on any type of job.  Her dream is to own a large grocery store where she can offer a wider variety of products.  She is requesting a loan to stock her store, adding variety because she knows it will attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries, canned goods, and beverages to stock the store.

loans.name: Narine

texts.ru:
Нарине 40 лет и она проживает в г.Севане. Нарине замужем, имеет двух дочерей школьного возраста. После окончания Ереванского педагогического института 5 лет проработала в детском саду воспитательницей. Муж работает электриком.
7 лет назад Нарине основала свой собственнный бизнес: торговлю сувенирами, игрушками, канцелярскими товарами, бижутерией и др. Предпринимательскую деятельность она осуществляет в арендованном магазине. 
Лето для курортного города Севан - сезон  расширения торговли, в частности, торговли товарами, предназначенными для пляжного отдыха. Поэтому Нарине решила расширить свой бизнес и начать торговлю пляжными принадлежностями. Для преобретения купальников, пляжных полотенец, шляп, надувных матрасов и т.д. Нарине необходим кредит в размере 300.000 драмов. Данный кредит, получаемый Нарине от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon), является пятым по счету.
texts.en:
Narine is forty years old and she lives in Sevan. Narine is married and has two school-age daughters. When she graduated from Yerevan Teacher Training College, she worked as a kindergarten teacher for five years. Her husband works as an electrician.

Seven years ago, Narine opened her own business.  She sells souvenirs, toys, office supplies, costume jewelery, etc. She rents her shop.

Sevan is a resort city, so in the summer sales are brisk--especially in goods to take to the beach.  Therefore, Narine has decided to expand her business and to begin trade in beach accessories. In order to buy bathing suits, beach towels, hats, inflatable mattresses etc., Narine needs to take out a loan for 300,000 drams. This loan from Nor Horizon is Narine's fifth.

loans.use: To buy swimsuits, towels, panamas, air beds, etc. for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and married to Mbatha, and they are blessed with four children, aged 20, 16, 10 and 8. He has been operating his shoe business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 13,500 which he uses to take care of his family.

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This will be his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to purchase stock of shoes and clothes for sale.

He plans to use the profit from his business to buy a pick-up for transporting shoes to other towns and to open a wholesale shoe shop. In the future, he hopes to be a wholesale seller and to be importing shoes from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with two children who are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a water supply business, selling in a shop and from door to door. His potential customers are neighbours. Simon faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the demand is low compared to the dry hot season where the demand is higher. He dreams of purchasing a motorcycle in the future. 

With the Kshs 80,000, he wants to purchase a motorcycle for transportation to start another business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.ru: Фахридин проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 54 года. Он женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Старший сын находится в России. Сам Фахридин более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Он сеет пшеницу, злаковые культуры и выращивает овощи для продажи. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений и химикатов.
texts.en: Fakhridin lives in Bohtar. He is 54 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. His eldest son is in Russia. Fakhridin has been farming for more than ten years. He grows wheat, grain, and vegetables for sale. He is taking out this loan to buy mineral fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en:
Kafa is a 51-year-old mother, and as she is a conservative woman her husband Mustafa appears in the photograph in her place. Kafa has two daughters and one son. Her children are college students. Kafa's husband is a worker in a tailoring workshop and responsible for the family expenses. 

Kafa's daughter is a brilliant student: she graduated with A+ grades from her BA program. Kafa's daughter Majeda wants to start an MA program but the family doesn't have the tuition fees, therefore Kafa took out a loan from FATEN to pay them. 

kafa's daughter hopes to finish school and start working to help her father take care of the family.

loans.use: To pay master's program tuition fees for her eldest daughter

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. She dreams of expanding and establishing a livestock and poultry business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase beans, rice and sugar for her restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and sugar for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 45 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 23 and 29. She runs a general merchant store in Grassfield, a neighborhood of Freetown.

Ramatu has been in this business for 10 years and sells provisions and building materials at her store. She also earns income from renting a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price control (inflation).

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more business commodities. Ramatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, she would like to be a supplier to other business partners.

loans.use: to purchase more business commodities.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 55-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon, is married and has 2 children. Ali has owned a cafe for 12 years and has much experience in this industry. Most of his customers are friends, relatives and other community members.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to buy necessary products, such as new cappuccino, Nescafe, coffee and tea trademarks requested by his customers. He hopes to do some small decorations for his business. Ali is very proud of the quality of his work and of the services he provides to his customers, and hopes to stay their number one choice in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary products to improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock to his shop and buy another cow.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa and her family own a wheat flour mill business. Maysa and her husband work in it. Due to the closure in the Gaza Strip, Maysa and her husband managed to have flour produced in their house and distribute it to houses and stores within Deir Al balah in the Gaza Strip. 

Maysa and her husband need pieces and accessories that should be added to the mill to enhance its performance, as well as bags to pack the flour. Maysa received a loan from FATEN for this purpose. 

Maysa is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed in her place.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour mill accessories and bags to pack flour in

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a goat meat business, buying and selling goats. She sells at wholesale to her neighbors and butcher shop operators. Salama faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
JamA., a 41-year-old entrepreneur, is married and has 3 children. He has been working in transportation for 14 years. His customers include all types of community members. JamA. is very proud of providing this service, especially in the high season, when tourists come and request to discover Lebanon.

JamA. is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, A. Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance on his car, which is his one and only source of living. JamA. hopes to open a tourist company in the future since he knows most of the beautiful places to be seen.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is 32 years old and married with 2 children, ages 7 months and 2 years. He runs a general merchant store in Grassfield, a neighborhood of Freetown

Abdul has been in this business for 6 years and sells televisions, DVD players and freezers at his store. He also earns income from small-scale farming. He says that the main challenge to his business is price control.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electronic appliances. Abdul says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings. In the future, he would like to be a supplier in a different store.

loans.use: To purchase more televisions and DVD players.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 28-year-old taxi driver from Palestine. He drives his car and transports passengers in the city where he lives. Anwar is married and has one son. 

Anwar shares the taxi with a partner therefore its income is not very big. Anwar took out a loan from FATEN to pay for car licensing and insurance fees as he can't pay the full amount at once. 

Anwar, who is photographed here, hopes that he will be able to fully own the car to have a better income.

loans.use: to pay insurance and car license fees

loans.name: Dismus

texts.en:
Dismus is 42 years old and married with three children. He comes from Kakamega, Kenya. He has had this business for ten years. His business is at Bukura Market and he targets all customers.

His vision is to buy a pickup that will enable him to carry his goods to the town to Bukura Market place. His dream is to have a wholesale store and more shops in different stations within five years.

Dismus is a hardworking man and determined.

loans.use: to purchase a strong refrigerator to store milk and other perishable goods.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 27 years old and married to Eliud.  The couple supports a family of four and her children are aged twelve, nine, six, and four years old.  She rears poultry on their farm and has been on the farm for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She has been given a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET which is her second loan, after she repaid the first loan successfully.  She wishes to use the money to purchase more chickens and  feed.  The profits will be used to expand her poultry farm and improve the welfare of her family.

She hopes to grow to greater heights in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a young woman married to Hatem; they have no children. They live in Palestine, where Haya's husband runs a grocery store. 

Haya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a wider variety of grocery items in order to attract more customers. Grocery stores are highly competitive due to their increasing number. 

Haya is a conservative woman, so her husband appears in the photograph in her place.

loans.use: to increase store inventory, attract more customers, and have a better income

loans.name: Robert Alekwa

texts.en:
Mr. Robert Alekwa is a 37-year-old man from Kakamega, in western Kenya.  He is married with two kids. He sells cereals, mostly maize, and petrol.  His business is located at Bukura market, next to the bus terminal.  

Mr. Robert's future hope is to buy a pickup for transporting maize and conducting other business activities.  He wishes to expand this business to the wholesale level and open a petrol station. He is very hard-working and visionary.

loans.use: to increase his stock of maize and purchase more petrol

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli was born in 1961. She lives in Azatamut village, Tavush Marz, with her husband and her daughter. For a long time Leyli worked as a engineer at Ijevan works, then as a mathematics teacher at the village school. 

Ten years ago, Leyli and her husband re-equipped their garage and started a food trading business in it. Their daughter helps them in the shop.  Thanks to their joint efforts they run their business successfully.  In their shop they sell food and household goods.  Through the business's profit,  Leyli and her family have bought furniture for their house, a car for goods delivery and they are able to support their family. 

Leyli is seeking a 700,000 AMD loan to buy beverages, food, sweets, confectionery and a large lot of household goods for her shop.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food, sweets, confectionery and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 57-year-old businessman who does quarry mining.  He is a widower with three children. He has been in the business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES.10,000 which he uses to meet all the basic needs of his family. 

He is applying for a second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to pay laborers.  With the anticipated profit he will purchase fertile land for farming. 

His hope and dream is to relocate his family to a better place.

loans.use: To pay laborers

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dried-fish business, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She also operates a motorcycle business which contributes another source of income. Mlongo dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Qalqilia. A year ago, he started a grocery store with an old store his father had. 

So that Muhammad can maintain a good reputation and have a number of customers he took out a loan from FATEN to paint the store's walls and install shelves.  He can now pay back the loan from the store's income. 

Muhammad is photographed in FATEN's branch in Qalqilia.

loans.use: to paint his grocery store's walls and install shelving

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en:
Roudayna, a 29-year-old entrepreneur, is married and has 3 children. She has owned a grocery store for 2 years. Her customers include friends and other community members. Roudayna is very passionate about her work and believes she can't live without it because it helps a lot with her family's income and in covering their expenses.

Roudayna is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to expand her business range by introducing new fruits and vegetables in her store and by providing better quality products with competitive prices. Roudayna hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To add new summer vegetables and fruits to her store

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a goat-meat selling business, selling wholesale to butcher-shop operators. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase goat meat for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and operating as a wholesale seller in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 67 years old. He is a businessman in quarry mining and livestock keeping, and he is married to Mary. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the business for the past 11 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings that he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for a fourth loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jonson will use the loan to pay laborers to work in the quarry. With the anticipated profit, he will add more livestock. 

His hopes and dreams are to live a comfortable life and serve the Lord in his old age.

loans.use: to pay laborers to work in the quarry.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old. She is widowed and has four grown-up children. She runs a grocery store in which she stocks kale, tomatoes, cabbages and green vegetables, all of which she sells to the local people. Her business is located in a residential area known as Huruma in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She has been in this business for nine years now. She says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase stock of groceries to grow her business while meeting the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to own a big grocery store and dreams of building a residential house for her family. She describes herself as God-fearing.

loans.use: to add stock.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 13 years. She is 64 years old and married to Joseph. They have four children. She practices small-scale farming and sells her harvest at the local market. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Lydia hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to neighbors and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, as well as disease outbreak and the high cost of chicken feeds. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 70,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Jallal

texts.en:
JallA., a 36-year-old married man, lives in Tyre and has two children. Because of the hard living situation he is facing, JallA. works in severA. types of businesses, such as transportation and agriculture, as well as owning a bakery. He works hard to improve his businesses by buying new products and providing good service. His customers are relatives, neighbors and friends.

JallA. has requested a loan from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to perform necessary maintenance on his car and increase his bakery's capitA. in addition to buying a new oven. He’s an honest man with good customer service. JallA. hopes to expand his business more and continue to provide a healthy life for his family.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 34, is married to Daniel, who sells cattle. They are blessed with four children, aged 4, 6, 12 and 13 years. 

She runs a retail shop, which she has been doing for 16 years. The business earns her a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD, and she has successfully managed to pay her previous loans. She will use the funds to buy six bags of sugar, detergents and five bales of flour.

Mary hopes to educate her children and run a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy six bags of sugar, detergents and five bales of flour for sale.

loans.name: Supa

texts.en:
Supa is a married woman with children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been selling a variety of used clothes in Olkalou town for the last two years. She is 48 years old, and the single mother of five school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell. She wants to take advantage of July, which is a cold season in Olkalou and surrounding towns.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent shop from where to sell, as she currently sells from the roadside.

loans.use: to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old businessman single and has no children.  In 2006, he established his lubricants, inner tubes and spare parts business. He began his business because he was trained as an auto mechanic and decided to open this type of business because of his knowledge in dealing with spare parts. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL (~$187) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of  3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy lubricants, inner tubes and spark plugs for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 (SLL) (~$58). 

In the future, he plans to grow his business to the point of becoming a supplier, and to build a dwelling house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy lubricants, inner tubes and spark plugs.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills and electricity. 

For the past three years, she has operated an ice cubes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Sofia dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 (KES) she wants to purchase another freezer for storing ice cubes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase another freezer for storing ice cubes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years. He is 54 years old, married to Mirriam, and they have five school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. 

He will sell his produce in the local market. In future, James hopes to practice large scale farming in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva was born in 1953 and she lives in Gandzakar village in the Tavush region. She is married and has 4 children who are already married. Silva’s younger son’s family lives with Silva. 

For about 20 years Silva worked for a carpet manufacturer as a storekeeper. Since 1993 she has engaged in pig keeping and hothouse farming. In her hothouse she generally grows verdure for sale. Silva’s husband works as a sawmill operator, but he also helps his wife in her occupation. Thus, Silva solves a part of her family’s needs.  

Silva needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy pig fodder and to repair her hothouse.

loans.use: To buy pig fodder and to repair her hothouse.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is twenty-six years old, divorced, and has two children aged eight and two years old. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy local market in Kakamega. She sells vegetables, onions and tomatoes to the local people. She has engaged in this kind of business for the last five years despite the fact that competition is high because there are many people in the area engaged in the same kind of business as hers.

She is using her loan of 80,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She dreams of buying her own land and building her own shop. She also sees herself being the biggest greengrocer in Khayega. She is a very hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Barbra's Group

texts.en:
Barbra is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Barbra has a small retail shop business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business running a clinic.
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay laborers to work in the quarry.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase furniture seats for her restaurant, bundles of wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture seats for her restaurant, bundles of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Ezinabala Development Group

texts.en: 30-year-old Teddy has been in a fruits and vegetables sales business for 7 years now. The happily married mother of 3 runs her business from Lugazi in central Uganda. She says she got inspired by a friend to start this business. Before that, fish selling was what occupied most of her time. Weekly she says this business generates profits totaling about 150,000 KES (~$  ). With this loan she says she is going to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell. In the group photo, one male member's face was partly obscured. I marked him as Unpictured.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more home furniture to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This is a 57 year-old business man.  He is married, and has four children. In 2001, the borrower established his bed foam and suit case business. He began his business because he wanted to be an owner of a reliable business so that he can get enough income to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. The borrower requires a loan in order to achieve his first dream of expanding from stall to shop, and he is planning to build another house. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000 . In the future, the borrower plans on improving his marketing skills. He is a very hard working business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bed foam and suit cases for his business.

loans.name: Elivase

texts.en: Elivase is 26 years old. He has two children who are ages three and seven years old, the youngest is in school. His wife is a business woman. Elivase sells scrap (old metallic subsistence) He has done this business for the past four years and his business is doing well. He is requesting a loan to buy more scrap from which he expects to make profits. He plans to continue meeting the needs of his family with the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying scrap for sale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a dressmaking business, her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a vegetable selling business, which contributes as another source of income. Lilian dreams of establishing a dressmaking college in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes for sale and cloth materials for her dressing making business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes for sale and cloth materials for her dressing making business.

loans.name: Verene

texts.en: Verene is 27 years old. She is a mother of two children who are ages 5 and 13 years old. They are all in school and she works hand in hand with her husband to raise these children. Her husband is a technician. Verene sells food stuffs such as beans, sorghum, etc. and she has been doing this business for five years. This business enables her to educate and feed her family. She needs a loan in order to buy more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to buy more food stuffs and make more profits. Verena plans to renovate her house with the profits she plans to make

loans.use: Buying food stuffs.

loans.name: Nakyanzi

texts.en:
Nakyanzi is a 40 year old single lady with three children. She has been running her salon and cosmetics shop for the past fourteen years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 12,000 which she uses to take care of her family.

She has borrowed KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to purchase more stock of items like cosmetics, chemicals and weaves and also to open another salon in another area.

She plans to use the profit from her business to open up another branch and buy another dryer. In the future, she hopes to have several salons from Mulolongo, Athi River and Kitengela.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like cosmetics and chemicals and to open another salon.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase construction supplies, sand, and cement to construct real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies, sand, and cement to construct real estate houses.

loans.name: Xevera

texts.en: Xevera is a mother of four children who are ages 4-18 years old. She is 41 years old and she is very hard working. She owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items which include cooking oil, soap, rice, etc. Xevera has done this business for two years. This business enabled her to achieve several things such as buying a cow from which she gets milk for her family. The business has also fed her family as well as educate her children. She needs a loan to buy more items such as cooking oil and soap and fill her store in order to make more profits.

loans.use: Buy more items for her shop such as cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high of cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and jerrycan of paraffin. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and jerrican of paraffin.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 57 years old businessman in quarry mining. He is married to Grace who helps him in the same business. They are blessed with three adult children. He has been in the business for the past 16 years with a monthly income of Kes 10,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his 5th loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to pay laborers to cut and shape building stones.

With the anticipated profit he will purchase another quarry with the target of increasing income. His hope and dream is to purchase a piece of land for his family.

loans.use: To pay laborers to work in the quarry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy cows, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and married to Josphat. The couple is blessed with three children, ages six, 14 and 16. For the past nine years, Cecilia has run a photocopier, stationery, and M-Pesa (cell phone-based payment system) business. She earns a monthly income of about 26,850 KES to take care of her family.

Cecilia is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more stationery and repair her photocopier machine. This will be her second loan from KADET. Cecilia will use her anticipated profit to open another branch in Kitengela.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to establish a wholesale stationery store in Kitengela and open another M-Pesa outlet.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and repair photocopy machine

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are electricity and water bills.

For the past four years, Constance has operated a greenhouse business, selling wholesale goods from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She also plants and farms vegetables to sell, which contributes to her other source of income. Constance’s major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

Constance decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farming business. In the future, she dreams of establishing many greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Josiha

texts.en:
Josiha is 44 years old. His spouse is Ann, and they have two children, aged 10 and 6 years.  

He runs a butchery in the Kiboswa trading center and has been in the business for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings.

He has borrowed a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings for his first term loan from KADET, and he hopes to use the money to purchase a sheep and goats for slaughter. The profits will be used for the welfare of his family.

He hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and the other is too young. Asha owns a house that has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Asha has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. Asha’s main business challenge is delayed payments by her customers. She dreams of owning a matatu (public service vehicle) in the future.

Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to start a clothing business and purchase clothes and cloth material to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and materials to start a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 48 years old, married and supports a family of six. He has been in the farming business for the last 32 years, with a monthly income of KES 4,000.  He plans to use his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET to purchase farm supplies for his family farm. This will help in boosting his earnings. His future plans are to expand his farm business and to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Kings Of Kings Group

texts.en: Fatuma, 34 years old, has operated a retail shop in Lugazi for the last decade. The mother of 5 says she began this business after she realized there was no general merchandise retail outlet in her neighborhood. Prior to that, Fatuma did subsistence farming. She still does subsistence farming though on a much smaller scale. Fatuma's monthly profits total 300,000 UGX. She plans to use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old and supports two children, 6 and 14 years old. She has been rearing dairy cows in Itigo and supplying milk to the nearby trading centre for six years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Susan has borrowed a second loan from KADET, for KES 20,000, having successfully repaid her previous loan. She hopes to use this money to purchase dairy feed for the animals. The reinvested profits will be used to add more dairy cows to the farm. Susan hopes to have a bright future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old and married to Elizabeth. The couple has five children. For the past two years, George has been selling shoes in Olkalou town. 

George was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell at his place. In the future, George hopes to grow his business, move into a more permanent location, and be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 62 years old and the single mother of three. For the past 31 years, she has worked as a wholesale grocery supplier and she also has rental houses. Mary earns a monthly income of 66,000 KES from her businesses. 

Mary is requesting a loan to buy groceries and renovate her rental houses. This will be her third loan from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. Mary intends to use her expected profits to build more rental houses. In the future, she hopes to be able to have a variety of multi-storied buildings.

loans.use: to buy groceries and renovate rental houses

loans.name: Chitsala

texts.en:
Chitsala is a married man with five children. Two children attend school while three are under age. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Chitsala has operated a retail shop business, selling items retail to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking  oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking  oil for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 15 years. He is 41 years old, married to Hannah and they have three children who attend school.. 

John was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  He will sell his produce in the local market.

In future, John hopes to become a successful farmer in Olkalou and also to open a clothes shop to boost his income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school while two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, Rukia has operated a business of buying and selling cows and goats for meat  to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge because of the high cost of transportation in her business. Rukia dreams of purchasing more livestock in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase three cows for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost he business.

loans.use: To purchase three cows for sale.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Edison has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season there is the high cost of transportation of charcoal to his place of sale because of poor roads. Edison dreams of selling charcoal wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 Edison wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Appolinarie

texts.en:
Appolinarie is 33 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 3 and 12. Appolinarie sells sacks of charcoal in her store and her business is well-organized. She has one year of experience and works from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Appolinarie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Appolinarie will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Izakahle Group

texts.en:
Happiness is 47 years old, married with 5 children who are between ages 14 and 32. One of her children attends school. She earns income from the government’s child support grant. She also receives income from her husband who works for Capacity Company in Richard's Bay.

In the photo above, she is raising up her hand, wearing a white shirt. She’s been in business for the past 2 years and sells perfumes, snacks and clothes from her home.

Happiness requested this loan through WDB and KIVA to buy perfumes, snacks and clothes for resale. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time. In five years time she would like to have her own space in town to work properly.

She appreciates WDB and Kiva for helping her with this loan which has low interest.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, snacks and clothes.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with seven children. Five children attend school while two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a used clothing business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 Mupa wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, Mwanaisha has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the availability of charcoal is lower compared to demand. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 Mwanaisha wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 27 years old and married with two children between the ages of 4 and 6 years old. She sells items like rice, soap, body lotion, etc. from her boutique. Esperance has three year's experience and she works from 7 am until 11 pm every day.

Esperance has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business to buy more rice, sugar, water, soap, body lotion and so on. With this profit, Esperance will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, water, sugar, body lotion etc.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en: Jean Batiste is 36 years old. He has three children who are ages 6- 16 years of age. He sells different kinds of items which include sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap. Jean Batiste has had this business for 8years and his business is doing well. Jean Batiste is requesting a loan to buy  more items such as sugar, salt for  his store. He hopes to make profits from this capital and plans to save all his profits

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar and salt.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with six children.  Two children attend school while four are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwaka has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighborss and passersby. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With a loan of Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Thembalethu Group

texts.en:
Bongiwe is 29 years old and single with four children between 2 and 11 years old. Three of her children attend school. To provide income for her family, she sells clothes and food to her neighbors. She also receives income through a government child support grant. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy more clothes and food for her store. She has been doing this business for one year and says that the biggest challenge that her business faces is that her clients do not pay on time. 

With the extra income, she hopes to expand her store to a bigger location.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and food to sell

loans.name: Josette

texts.en: Josette, 27 years old, is the mother of a one-year-old child and her husband is a technician. Josette owns a store in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as beans, cooking oil, rice, etc. She has run this business for three years and it is doing well. This business  enables her to feed and meet the needs of her family and everything is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, beans and cooking oil to sell in order to make more profits. She wishes to use the profits to begin her family house construction.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single woman with one child, who is still young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, Mwanakombo has operated a business selling clothes to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Mwanakombo plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nery Concepción

texts.es: Nery Concepción, de treinta y tres años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa  e hijas Gabriela y Fatima quienes estudian.  Nery se dedica desde hace más de cinco años al servicio de transportar materiales de construcción como hierro, arena, grava, ladrillos, tierra, entre otros. Ésta es la única actividad que genera ingresos para él y es con la misma que lográ llevar lo necesario para su familia. Hoy su fuente de empleo, el camión, requiere de mantenimiento y comprar algunos repuestos dado que ha estado presentando algunas fallas, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando crédito a INTEGRAL con la plena confianza de que con esto hará las reparaciones necesarias y su camión se encuentre en óptimas condiciones y no tener que detenerse con la realización de viajes y así no le falte la seguridad económica a su familia y sus hijas puedan continuar realizando sus estudios.-
texts.en: Nery Concepción, 33, lives in his own house with his wife and daughters, Gabriela and Fatima who are in school.  For over five years Nery has been running a transportation business for construction materials such as iron, sand, gravel, bricks, and dirt, amonth other things.  This is his sole source of income for providing for his family.  Now his main work tool, his truck, is in need of maintenance and repair parts.  He is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL in the hopes that the necessary repairs will be what his truck needs to be in the best working condition.  This way he will not have to delay providing services which would cut off the family income, and his daughters can continue to study.

loans.use: To provide maintenance for his truck and buy repair parts.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For over a year, Josephine has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Josephine dreams of establishing another business in the future. She plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. Josephine decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one has graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water.

For the past four years, Fatuma has operated a vegetable stall business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale in the future. She plans on using this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Thade

texts.en:
Thade is a father of five children who ages range from 10 to 22 years old. He is 56 years old and very hardworking. Thade works with his wife selling secondhand clothes. He has been running this business for 20 years and it's doing well. It has enabled Thade and his wife to educate their children, feed the family and buy an exotic breed of cow which provides them with milk.

Thade needs a loan to purchase more clothes and make more profits. He bought a piece of land which he partially paid for, and plans to pay the balance in installments. Thade will use the profits to help pay for the land.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe del Carmen, de treinta y cuatro años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos menores hijas Ruth y Karina, quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la localidad, Guadalupe tiene instalado un negocio de costureria en la misma casa en donde reside, que es propiedad de un hermano que le apoya facilitándole la misma para que pueda salir adelante con sus hijas, tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia confeccionando diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir, desde una sencilla falda hasta vestidos para ocasiones especiales, ella es muy reconocida en la zona por la calidad con la que confecciona y lo accesible del precio que cobra, a esto se debe su amplia clientela. Guadalupe tiene bajo su responsabilidad todo el cargo de su hogar es por ello que dado que las exigencias en los gastos de sus hijas van incrementando a medida ellas avanzan en sus estudios y dado que Guadalupe desea darles todo cuanto ella pueda y este a su alcance a fin de que culminen sus estudios convirtiéndose en profesionales, ella desea reinvertir en su negocio comprando telas, botones, hilos zíperes para confeccionar ropa que pondrá a la venta y piensa comercializar aprovechando los clientes que la visitan y porque no, pensando en proponerlas en mercado cercano a la localidad de donde reside y a ella le conocen por su excelente trabajo, además tiene en mente instalar en su misma casa una pupusería, son estas las razones por las que necesita el crédito y echar a andar sus ideas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe del Carmen, 34, is a single mother and lives with her two minor daughters, Ruth and Karina, who study at the local school.  Guadalupe is a seamstress and works out of her home which belongs to a brother of hers who is helping out so she can raise her daughters.  For over ten years she has been making different types of clothing, anything from a simple skirt to special occasion dresses.  She is very well-known in the area for her quality work and low prices, and has many customers.  

Guadalupe is responsible for the entire household and she realizes expenses are increasing as her daughters get older.  Since she wants to give them all she can so they can finish their education and become professionals, she wants to reinvest in her business buying fabric, buttons, thread and zippers to make clothing for her customers and maybe even start selling at a near-by market.  Everyone knows her because of her excellent work.  She is also thinking about setting up a "pupusería" (stuffed tortillas), and the loan would help put her ideas into motion.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, thread and zippers for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a divorced woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the others have graduated from school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past seven years, she has sold onions at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of onions for sale and iron sheets for her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions for sale and iron sheets for her house.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
