Dorris is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that they own. It has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. For the past 10 years, she has been selling clothes in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Dorris faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of opening another business in the future.

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and shoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 36 years old and married with four children between the ages 10 and 15 years old. Speciose sells tomatoes and onions in her store. Her business is well organized. She has three years of experience in her business and she works from 6 A.M. until 8 P.M. every day. Speciose currently employs one person to help her. Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Speciose will reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, etc

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra. Albina, ella es la presidenta del comité, vive en la cuidad Concepcion.
La presidenta se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una vision de que a través del comité estarian alcanzando el progreso de cada una.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras, Nombrandolo COMITÉ VIRGEN DEL CARMEN. 
El comité cuenta con diez (10) miembros, donde la mayoria se dedica a pequeñas actividades desde la venta de minutas como: empanadas, marineras, butifarras, chipas, tortas, dulces  de tal manera que puedan octener mayores ingresos para sus familias. 
Solicitan el crédito para poder comprar ingredientes para los productos alimenticios que venden como ser carne, especias, huevos y demás.
Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Mrs. Albina, the president, who lives in the city of Concepción.  The president wanted to help her friends by giving them the idea that each one could progress if they formed a group.

They were all happy to establish the women entrepreneur group called "COMITÉ VIRGEN DEL CARMEN".  There are ten members and most of them have small businesses selling food items such as pies, seafood, sausages, chips, cakes, or sweets to obtain more income for their families.

They are requesting a loan to buy ingredients for their food products such as meat, spices, eggs, etc.  They all hope to be able to get ahead for their individual and community development.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. For the past six months, he has run a vegetable stall, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the hot dry season, the availability of vegetables is minimal compared to the demand, which is high. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a divorced woman with eight children, five of whom attend school while the others have already graduated. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, Mary has operated a business selling coconuts and mangoes at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Mary dreams of expanding her business in the future. She plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of mangoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes for sale.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristobal, tiene 38 años, esta casado con la señora Ismelda, de 28 años, ellos son de la Ciudad de Concepción, están casados desde hace más de ocho años , tienen dos hijos, uno está iniciando su ciclo escolar y el otro esta en el tercer grado.
Ambos dejaron sus estudios, la Sra. Ismelda lo dejo al casarse con el Sr. Cristobal, y este actualmente se encuentra cursando sus estudios en el mismo colegio que sus hijos.
Anteriormente vivian en otra ciudad, donde donde el Sr. Cristobal se dedicaba a trabajar como chofer en la empresa de los Hermanos Hurbieta, después vendió su casa de ahí para mudarse. Actualmente se dedica a la produccion de carbon, con lo que lleva el sustento a su familia.
Solicita el credito para poder equipar un poco mas sus hornos de produccion de carbon, con lo cual cree que pdra aumentar sus ingresos. Piensa que este crédito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Cristobal is 38 and married to his wife Ismelda, 28, and both live in Concepción.  They have been married for 8 years and have 2 children, who are studying. Cristobal and his wife did not finish their studies, but are taking supplemental courses in the same school where their children are enrolled. He had lived and worked in another city, working as a driver for the Hermanos Hurbieta, but after selling his house there, he now works producing charcoal to support his family.  Cristobal seeks this credit in order to increase production by establishing more brick ovens, and thus hopes to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy equipment for charcoal production

loans.name: Dulce Maria Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "DULCE MARIA" porque la señora venD. dulces y se llama Luz, esta ubicado en el estado D. México, esta conformado por 9 integrantes, la señora Luz es la tesorera D. grupo, tiene 36 años, estudio la primaria, tienen 3 hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones) ella se dedica a la venta D. dulces con el cual lleva 5 años, solicita el prestamo para invertir en variedad D. dulces que le solicitan sus clientes ya que la mayoria son niños así como para fiestas infantiles que es donD. le realizan pedidos grandes y son sus mejores ventas, con las ganancias quiere ahorrar y seguir pidiendo prestamos para posteriormente tener un local fijo, ella se siente contenta porque pueD. contribuir con el gasto D. su familia, además D. apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan estudios y una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called "Dulce María" (Sweet María) because one of the ladies sells sweet treats and is called María Luz.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and has nine members.  Luz is the group's treasurer.  She is 36 years old, has an elementary school level of education, and has three children (one daughter and two sons).  Her business is selling sweet treats and she has been in this business for five years.

Luz is requesting a loan to invest in a range of sweet treats that her customers are requesting.  Most of her customers are children.  She receives large orders from children's parties and this is where she makes her best sales.  With the profits from her business, she would like to save up and continue requesting loans so that she can eventually obtain her own fixed premises.  She feels happy because she is able to contribute towards her family's expenses and also support her children so that they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in a range of sweet treats

loans.name: Mario Efrain

texts.es: Mario Efrain, cuenta con treinta y seis años de edad, vive junto a Don Mario y Doña Blanca sus papás, a Efrain desde muy pequeño siempre le gusto bailar y su gusto por este arte fue incrementando a medidas pasaron los años, fue así como su gusto por refinar este Arte le permitió instalar un centro de baile en un local en el centro de la ciudad en la que vive, en donde los clientes que le visitan se divierten sanamente haciendo aerobics ó bailando un amplio repertorio de géneros musicales que él muy bien baila y como instructor dirige. Los clientes que le visitan bailan para bajar de peso o simplemente relajarse y salir por un momento de sus cotidianas vidas. El negocio de Efrain cada vez mejora gracias a que sus clientes se encuentran muy a gusto con esta actividad, él ahora desea comprar con el crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL un nuevo equipo de sonido que haga vibrar aún más a sus clientes y como él dice:  “suden todo lo malo que traen y lo dejen acá”, confía en que con esta inversión sus mismo clientes le contacten con mas amigos y los lleven a que disfruten en una sesión de baile en que las personas se alegren por estar en perfecta condición de salud.-
texts.en:
Mario Efrain is 36 years old and lives together with his parents: Mario and Blanca.  Efrain has enjoyed dancing since he was very young and his love for this art increased as he got older.  His desire to refine the art allowed him to set up a dance center in premises in the center of the town where he lives.  Clients visit him and have healthy fun, doing aerobics or dancing a wide repertoire of musical styles that Efrain himself dances very well and leads as an instructor.  The clients who visit his business dance to lose weight or simply to relax and escape their daily lives for a while.

Efrain's business is constantly improving thanks to the fact that his clients feel very happy and comfortable with this activity.  Efrain would like to use the loan that he is requesting from INTEGRAL to buy a new sound system that will move his clients even more.  As he says "they sweat out all the bad stuff that they bring with them and leave it here".  He believes that, with this new investment, his clients will put him in touch with more friends and bring them along to enjoy a dance session in which people are delighted to be in perfect health.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for his dance classes

loans.name: Shalom 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Teolinda is one of the members of the “Shalom 5 & 7” group, located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. Teolinda's principal economic activity is the sale of clothing. She is the mother of five children, four or whom live with her and their father. She tells us that her most difficult challenges are having sufficient money to cover her family's needs and to have her own house. Teolinda's favorite activity is serving in her business. Teolinda is very moved by receiving her 10th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily, thereby having taken a step towards her business's growth. She has had her business for around five years. She set it up when she saved enough money to start a business and was immediately able to have her first Esperanza loan, all of which she invested in her business.

Teolinda will use this loan to purchase jeans, shoes and women's clothes such as blouses, skirts, underwear and other items. She is planning to use her business profits to reinvest and save. Teolinda's most important dreams are to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants and blouses

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For the past three years, Dama has operated a business selling kikois (an East African version of a wrap or sarong) from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Dama dreams of expanding her business in the future. She plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of khangas (a traditional type of dress amongst women in central/east Africa) for sale. Dama decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of khangas for sale.

loans.name: Ravasco

texts.en:
Ravasco is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six months, Ravasco has operated a soap making business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He also sells paraffin as another source of income. Ravasco faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Ravasco plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase paraffin for sale and to start a charcoal sales business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin for sale and to start a charcoal sales business.

loans.name: Wilber Alfredo

texts.es: Wilber Alfredo, de veintiséis años de edad, soltero, vive en casa de su mamá, la señora Carmen y Don Ruben compañero de vida de su madre. Wilber posee un local dentro del mercado regional del lugar en que vive y ahí vende zapatos para todas las edades, géneros y gustos. Ya son mas de tres años los que lleva de comercializar dicho producto y el negocio va para adelante sin detenerse, cuenta muy feliz Wilber. Con los ingresos que percibe Wilber ayuda a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y también se encuentra ahorrando porque desea continuar estudiando en la Universidad, es por esto su esmero en reinvertir a su negocio a través del crédito que INTEGRAL le otorgue, para comprar nuevos estilos de zapatos para mujeres, porque es la clientela que mas demanda este producto y poder incrementar sus ventas y en consecuencia sus ganancias y así tener el dinero necesario para iniciar sus estudios y continuar ayudando a la economía en su hogar
texts.en:
Wilber Alfredo is 26 years old, single, and lives in the house of his mom (Carmen) and her life partner (Ruben). 

Wilber has premises in the regional market where he lives.  There he sells shoes for all ages, styles and tastes.  He has been selling shoes for more than three years and a very happy Wilber tells us that his business is moving forward without stopping.  With the income that he makes, Wilber helps his mom with the household expenses.  He is also saving up because he would like to continue studying at university.  This is why he will take care to re-invest in his business through the loan he receives from INTEGRAL.  He will buy new styles of ladies' shoes because these are the customers who most request his products.  This will enable him to increase his sales, and thereby his profits, so that he will have the money he needs to start his studies and continue financially supporting his household.

loans.use: to buy new styles of ladies' shoes

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 21  años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios para trabajar y con las ganancias comprar una casa.

Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y le gusta jugar boly e indor, ademas una de las costumbres del recinto es realizar las fiestas patronales en Octubre.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

This community bank is called "26 de Noviembre" and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Juan is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase production.  He faces challenges in his business such as pests which attack his crops.  His dream is to own his own land which he can work and then use the profits to buy a house.

Juan is noted as being a responsible person and he enjoys playing volleyball and indoor soccer.  In addition, one of the customs in his town is to celebrate the local fiesta in October.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor Hugo tiene 24  años, es soltero vive con solo no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Victor se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo is 24 years old. He is single and lives alone as he has no children. He lives in El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

This community is named V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre. It is located in the Las Blancas compound, belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This community has ten members who are dedicated to short-cycle farming work. They farm maize, rice and beans.

Victor is dedicated to farming, especially maize, rice and beans. He buys them in Ventanas every month and sells them in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his necessities, expand production and face disadvantages like pests that attack his crops. His dream is to have his own lands.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Denge

texts.en:
Denge is a married man with one child. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, Denge has operated a water sales business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of water rationing, thereby not meeting his customers' daily needs. Denge dreams of expanding his business in the future. He plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase carts for use in water distribution. Denge decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase carts for use in water distribution.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus hijos Wilfredo y Rosa, el primero que trabaja como cobrador D. bus y esto ayuda a la economía del hogar y Rosa quien por ser menor D. edad sólo estudia. Ana ha crecido a sus hijos desD. hace mas D. 10 años a puro esfuerzo D. la venta D. Tamales D. Elote. DesD. muy temprano sale a comprar los elotes tiernos que son necesarios para que su tamal cuente con el gusto que a sus clientes les agrada, al regresar D. comprarlo lo prepara para llevarlo al molino y estando lista esta etapa cocina con mantequilla la masa y la sazona procurando que sus tamales estén listos antes D. las 2 pm, a la vez realiza las demás actividades hogareñas que demanda su casa. Al tenerlos listos a las 2 D. la tarD. lleva sus ricos tamales cargándolos en su cabeza a vender al mercado regional cercano a donD. vive, ahí es muy conocida Ana por vender los pupulararmente conocidos como “tamales charitos”. Ana ahora desea comprar mayor cantidad D. elote, mantequilla y leña para hacer sus tamales dado que entrando a la época D. invierno son mas solicitados, espera que con el crédito que INTEGRAL le otorgue poder realizar sus ideas y esto haga que obtenga mayor cantidad D. ganancias que al final beneficien a su familia.-
texts.en: Ana Julia is a single mother and lives alongsiD. her children, Wilfredo and Rosa, the first of whom works as a bus conductor and this helps with the home expenses and Rosa, who still being young, only studies. Ana has raised her children for more than ten years through the pure effort of selling corn tamales. Starting early, she leaves to buy tender corn that is necessary for her tamales to taste as her customers like. Upon returning from buying them, she prepares them to bring them to the mill and being ready, at this stage she cooks the dough with butter and seasons them making sure her tamales are ready before 2PM. At that time, she does the rest of the home chores that her house demands. Upon having them ready at 2 in the afternoon, she takes her delicious tamales, carrying them on her head, to sell in the regional market, near where she lives. There Ana is well-known for selling them popularly known as "tamales charitos". Ana now wishes to buy a greater quantity of corn, butter and firewood to make her tamales since during the winter season there are more orders. She hopes that with the loan that INTEGRAL gives her, she can accomplish her ideas and therefore obtain more income which will ultimately benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of corn, butter and firewood to make her tamales.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio tiene 24 años, es soltero vive con los padres. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como la falta de terrenos propios. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y un carro para trasladar la produccion a la feria y venderlos.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "26 de Noviembre" and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Luis is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  He faces challenges in his business such as the fact that he doesn't own his own land.  His dream is to buy hgis own land and a car for transporting his produce to the market to sell.

Luis enjoys taking part in sports.  He particularly enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Abdalla has operated a beauty salon business; his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Abdalla dreams of establishing a well furnished beauty shop in the future. He plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase cosmetics, perfume, oil relaxer and hair pieces. Abdalla decided to join Yehu to access loans to raise his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfume, oil relaxer and hair pieces.

loans.name: Perfecto Alberto

texts.es:
Perfecto Alberto tiene 65 años, es soltero vive con una  hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Perfecto  se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Disfruta mucho escuchar musica nacional.
texts.en:
Perfecto Alberto is 65 years old, single, and lives with one of his daughters in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Perfecto is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Perfecto is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  He doesn't face any great challenges in his work.  His dream is to own his own home.

Perfecto very much enjoys listening to Ecuadorian music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia lives in Uganda and is a single mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (a cousin and her daughters). Leonia has operated a pub business for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT in order to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local brews.

Leonia also gets additional income by selling piped water. She works from her home seven days a week. Leonia's business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She hopes to see her business grow big, to own a fully stocked bar, to buy a plot of land and to educate her children up to university. Leonia lives in a two-room house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy beer and local gin

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

For the past three years, James has operated a business selling at retail and wholesale to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. James dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. He plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to renovate his retail shop and to purchase timber, paint and glass for display. James decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To renovate his retail shop and to buy timber, paint and glass for display.

loans.name: Cefferino Gustavo

texts.es:
Cefferino Gustavo tiene 43 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Cefferino se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar los productos a vender en las ferias.

Le gusta hacer deporte, y festejar las fiestas de patrono del Recinto en Octubre.
texts.en:
Cefferino Gustavo is 43 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their children. He lives in El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

This area is called V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, which is found located in Recinto Las Blancas, belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This area has ten members who are dedicated to short-cycle farming planting maize, rice and beans.

Cefferino is dedicated to farming, especially maize, rice and beans. He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and sells them in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his necessities and expand production. His dream is to have a car to transport the products he sells at the markets.

He enjoys playing sports and celebrating the holiday of the patron of Recinto in October.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Campo Group

texts.es:
La señora Santa Pascuala, tiene 31 años D. edad, tiene 1 hijos el cual está estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y como también al comercio a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad ya que cuenta con una tienda D. consumo diario, inicio este negocio por medio D. u pequeño préstamo que había hecho anteriormente,  y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia con este negocio.

DeciD. organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo y ampliar el capital D. trabajo D. la tienda que tiene, va a compra más producto para la tienda: jugos, aguas gaseosas, frutas, azúcar, jugos en lata, comida en lata, golosinas, dulces, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a diversas actividades que S.: Venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, venta D. ropa típica, venta D. calzado, tejido D. sabanas, veta D. helados, confección D. pantalones y a la crianza D. animales. En el futuro esperan ver su negocio aun mayor y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Santa Pascuala is 31, has one S. in school and works at home as well as selling basic items in a small store.  She began her sales with a prior loan and has run her business for the last 10 years.  Now Santa Pascuala has organized a group loan and hopes to grow her working capital for her store.  She plans to buy general merchandise such as juices, soft drinks, fruit, sugar, canned beverages, tinned foods and sweets.  Others in her group work in diverse trades such as sales of general items, clothing, shoes, sheets, ice cream, sewing and animal husbandry.   The group is very hopeful that they can increase their future sales and incomes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past two years, Linet has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables such as maize flour, rice and sugar to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Linet dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future. She plans on using this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of soap, detergents, wheat flour and maize flour. Linet decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase soaps, detergents, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es:
Maria Eusebia tiene 46 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Mauro de 19 años y Evelyn de 11 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para cumplir con las metas de ver a mis hijos profesionales.

Le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Maria Eusebia is 46 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their children, Mauro, 19, and Evelyn, 11. He lives in El Cantón Ventanas, a province of Los Ríos.

This village bank is named V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE. It can be found located in Recinto Las Blancas, belonging to Cantón Ventanas. This village bank has ten members who are dedicated to short-cycle farming work, planting maize, rice and beans.

Maria is dedicated to farming, especially planting maize, rice and beans. She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and sells them in the market of the same town.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. The support of the loan would help her economically to supply the necessities and expand production. She does not face important disadvantages. Her dream is to continue working to achieve her goals to see her children become professionals.

She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa del Rosario tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Denilson 10 años, Nayely 9 años y Lady 7 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Luisa se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y darles la educacion a los hijos.

Le gusta mucho escuchar musica y bailar.
texts.en:
Luisa del Rosario is 42 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her children: 10 year-old Denilson, 9 year-old Nayely and 7 year-old Lady.  They live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Luisa is a farmer.  In particular, she grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the street market in the same town.

Luisa is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs and increase her production.  Her dream is to continue working and to provide her children with an education.

Luisa really enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Biimu

texts.en:
Biimu is a married woman with two children; one attends school and one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Biimu's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Biimu has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a café in the future. Biimu plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to build a shelter, purchase timber and iron sheets and pay labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to build a shelter, purchase timber and iron sheets and pay labor

loans.name: Vicente Rufino

texts.es:
Vicente Rufino tiene 58 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Vicente se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para tener una casa comoda y grande y no tener tantas necesidades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Vicente Rufino is 58 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Vicente is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Vicente is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  He faces challenges in his business such as pests which attack his crops.  His dream is to make more income so that he can have a large, comfortable house and not experience so many needs.

Vicente enjoys taking part in sports and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Dios Es Bueno 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She is the coordinator of her group Dios es bueno 1, 2 & 3 (God is Great). Margarita's group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Her community is a batey, where most of the citizens are Haitians who emigrated to work in different industries in the Dominican Republic. This group is composed of 15 Haitian businesswomen.

Margarita has had her business for around a year. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing bread, jam, cheese, fruits, sugar and snacks for her food stall, where she will add more meals, such as rice, beans and meat to sell for lunch. Her profits will be used as savings because her children will start school again in about 3 months and she need the money for their school supplies.

Margarita makes her home in a simple structure with her four children and her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to educate and raise her children in a foreign country and to proviD. what her spouse can't. By working and selling, she helps to bring income to her household. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook and have fun with her family by watching tv and doing other activities.

loans.use: to buy goods such as fruits, vegetables, sugar, onions, cheese, bread, rice, etc.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past three years, Purity has operated a clothing sales business, selling at wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are seasonality and the high cost of transportation. Purity dreams of owning a boutique business in the future. She plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase three bales of secondhand clothes for sale. Purity decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Victoria Eloisa

texts.es:
Victoria Eloisa tiene 48 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los seis hijos todos menores de edad. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Victoria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es viajar a Galapagos.

Le gusta escuchar usica y bailar.
texts.en:
Victoria Eloisa is 48 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their six dependent children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  This group has 10 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Victoria is a farmer.  In particular, she grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the street market in the town.

Victoria is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs and increase her production.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests which attack her crops.  Her dream is to travel to the Galapagos Islands.

Victoria enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Joayhu Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señora Claudia,  que vive en la ciudad de Concepción.
La presidenta se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una vision de que a través del comité estarian alcanzando el progreso de cada una.
Ellas se pusieron muy contentas al formar el grupo al que llamaron Joayhu, este comite está formado por 14 mujeres, en donde todas ellas trabajan de forma activa, sacrifida y muy emprendedora.
Poseen un local de minutas, donde venden empanadas, marineras, asaditos, tambien chipas, tortas, y dulces, cada una se encarga de la elaboracion de todos aquellos alimentos que ofrecen a los clientes. Ellos poseen ya una clientela muy bien definida.
Solicitan el credito para la compra de los ingredientes de las comidas que producen, como ser carne, especias, huevos, harina, mandioca, etc.
Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Claudia who lives in the city of Concepción.  The group's president was motivated by the idea of creating something good for her fellow group members, giving them the sense that, through the committee, each one of them would be making progress.

The women were all very happy to create their group which they named Joayhu.  This committee is made up of 14 women who all work in an active, selfless and very entrepreneurial manner.

The ladies own a snack bar where they sell empanadas, marineras and barbecued meat.  They also sell 'chipas' (cheese buns), cakes and sweet treats.  Each one of them takes care of preparing the food that they sell to their customers.  They have a very well-established customer base.

The women are requesting a loan to buy ingredients for the food that they produce such as meat, spices, eggs, flour, cassava, etc.  They all hope to continue working hard to get ahead in life.  They are looking to make progress themselves and also help their community to make progress.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the meals that they produce such as meat, spices, eggs, flour, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married, with three children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. Stella owns a cosmetics shop in Ndeeba selling all types of cosmetics such as cream relaxers, Vaseline, braids and weaves. She has been in this business for the last three years and sells at both retail and wholesale to all categories of people.

Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, Vaseline, braids and weaves. Her business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Stella hopes to see her business grow big so that she may own a bridal shop and start importing cosmetics herself. Stella lives in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Basilia Solange

texts.fr: Née en le 2 janvier 1969 au Bénin, Basilia Solange est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Basilia Solange a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Basilia Solange n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Basilia Solange vend des produits divers (Riz, maïs, haricot, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) depuis une quinzaine d'année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Basilia Solange vend des glaces et des bissaps. Basilia Solange s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Basilia Solange sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born on January 2, 1969, in Benin, Basilia Solange is a widow living alone with her children.  She has three children, all who have completed or are attending school, two of whom are still under her care.  Her education ended after primary school.  To meet her and her children’s needs, Basilia Solange has been selling various products (rice, corn, beans, pasta, etc.) for about 15 years.  Along with this business, she sells ice cream and bissap (a non-alcoholic drink made from hibiscus).  Basilia Solange buys her supplies in one of the largest markets in Benin.  This business earns her income to help her cover her family’s various expenses.  In order to raise the level of her business activity and increase her profits, she is requesting her first loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products (rice, corn, beans, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es la presidenta de  la Empresa de Crédito comunal IDA Caña Blancal.

Gracias  al trabajo de todos los miembros de la empresa, muchas personas de la comunidad tienen ya su propia empresita, o han logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Por eso la empresa desea seguir creciendo y saben que para eso tienen que invertir en Tecnología. Por ella solicita un  préstamo de Por ella solicita un  préstamo de ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de computadora laptop, y una impresora multifuncional.

Con el préstamo esperan crecer para poder ofrecerle mejores servicios a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Elsa is the president of the IDA Caña Blancal loan company.

Thanks to the work of all the members of the company, many people in their community now have their own small businesses or have managed to improve their living conditions.

For this reason, the company would like to continue growing and they know that, for this to happen, they must invest in technology.  Elsa is therefore requesting a loan for 400,000 colones to buy a laptop computer and a multi-function printer.

Through this loan, they hope their company will grow so that they can offer better services to their community.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and a printer

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es:
Henry Francisco tiene 21 años, es soltero vive con los padres y no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Henry se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es superarse, llegar a tener casa propia y comprar un vehiculo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Henry Francisco is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Henry is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Henry is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  His dreams are to improve himself, to own his own home and to buy a vehicle.

Henry enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Primavera Ii Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Sra. Agustina, que vive en la ciudad de Concepcion. La presidenta se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una vision de que a través del comité estarian alcanzando lsa metas que cada una tiene para su futuro.
Formaron juntas el comité denominado Primavera, el cual cuenta con 15 miembros actulmente, todas ellas con un gran espiritu de lucha, ya que cada una desea el progreso para sus familiares, asi como para ellas mismas.
Todas se dedican a la venta de minutas, como empanadas, tortillas, y demas, cuentan con una variedad un poco limitada para lo que ellas desean, por lo cual les gustaria poder invertir un poco mas en su negocio.
Solicitan el crédito para poder hacer una inversion en su pequeño local, con lo cual podran aumentar la variedad de sus productos y asi atraer mas clientes. Sueñan que en un futuro no muy lejano les estaria produciendo una gran cantidad de alimentos con lo cual podan aumentar sus ganancias.
Todas tienen un gran espiritu de lucha y quieren un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
This committee was created thanks to Agustina who lives in the city of Concepción.  The president was motivated by the idea of creating something for her fellow group members, giving them all a sense that, through the committee, they would be reaching the goals that they each have for their future.

They created a committee called 'Primavera' (Spring) which currently has 15 members who all have a great fighting spirit since each one of them would like to make progress for the sake of their families as well as themselves.

All the members of the group sell snacks such as empanadas, tortillas, etc.  The range of snacks they offer is a little limited so they would like to be able to invest a little more in their business.  They are requesting this loan to invest in their small business.  This will enable them to increase the range of products that they offer and thereby attract more customers.  They dream that, in the not-too-distant future, they will be producing a large quantity of food which will enable them to increase their profits.

All of the members of this group have a great fighting spirit and want a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making the food that they sell

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
Carmen de 36 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es soltera y tiene dos hijos que estudian en escuela fiscales.

Comenzó su negocio hace un tiempo atrás desde que se separado de su esposo y decidió abrir una papelería por medio un préstamo que hizo en el Bono Solidario y después hizo otro en D-miro. Ella labora sola en su papelería desde las 7H00 am a 8H00 pm diariamente. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas mercadería para surtir su negocio. En un futuro dese agrandar su negocio y poder seguir educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old.  She lives in a peri-urban area of El Fortín de Guayaquil.  She is single and has two children who are attending public (state) schools.

Carmen started her business some time ago when she separated from her husband.  She decided to open a stationery store through a loan that she received from Social Security.  She then took out another loan from D-Miro.  Carmen works alone in her stationery store from 7.00am to 8.00pm every day.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy more merchandise to stock her store.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, composition books and pens

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam lives in Kawempe in Uganda. She is married with five children – all of them are school-going. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she owns. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Zam changed her business enterprise from selling spare parts to selling charcoal and has been in this business for a few months. She sells charcoal at the market and works seven days a week. She sells charcoal to all kinds of people, both retail and wholesale. Besides selling charcoal, she generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. Her business challenges include issues with transportation, the rainy season and defaulters. 

Zam requested 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Zam hopes to see her business grow big so that she can buy a delivery van to ease transport, and so she can get a permanent business premises. Zam decided to join MCDT because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la sra. Vilma, quien invito y organizo a sus amigas del barrio para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, puesto que todas tenían un sueño en común que era sacar a sus familias adelante y también para que ellas puedan sentirse útiles a la sociedad y a sus familias. 
La sra. Vilma se dedica a la costura, esta casaD. hace 20 años con el sr. Francisco, quien trabaja como chofer de una linea de transporte, tienen tres hijos estudiantes uno en la primaria, uno en la secundaria  y uno en la universidad. La señora Vilma se dedica a la costura ya hace mucho tiempo en el barrio donde vive, y gracias a eso ya ha adquirido gran clientela, su sueño es poder abrir en su propia casa un taller de costura y poder equiparse con lo necesario para seguir su trabajo decorosamente.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder armar un pequeño taller en su domicilio, ademas de eso poder equiparse con los insumos que llegaría a necesitar. Ella además de las otras integrantes del comité tienen todas sus esperanzas puestas en dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Vilma set up this committee.  She invited friends from her neighborhood to join the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Commitee of Entrepreneurial Women) program and organized the group as they all share the same dream of getting their families ahead in life.  They all also want to be able to feel of use to society and their families.

Vilma has a sewing business.  She has been married to Francisco, who works as a driver on a transport route, for 20 years.  They have three children who are all studying: one is in elementary school, one is in high school and one is at university.  Vilma has been running a sewing business in her neighborhood for a long time.  As a result, she has a large customer base.  Her dream is to be able to open a sewing workshop in her home and equip it with everything she needs to continue to carry out her work.

Vilma is requesting this loan to set up a small workshop in her home which she will equip with the supplies that she needs.  She and her fellow committee members have all their hopes placed in this loan.

loans.use: to set up a small workshop in her home and to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and soap.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past six years, she has been selling dry fish at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenges of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase five sacks of dry fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of dry fish for sale.

loans.name: Malita

texts.en:
Malita operates a retail shop and works six days a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her business like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. Malita has been in her business for ten years. She doesn’t have any other side businesses. Her business challenges include transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her shop in Kamwokya. 

Malita is married with four children who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. They live in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family. 

Malita hopes to see her business grow big so that she can start selling wholesale only and also own a delivery van to help with transportation. She decided to work with MCDT because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid forma parte del banco comunal “Los comerciantes” perteneciente a la comuna de Cerrillos, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende un almacén, ubicado en su casa. Aquí vende verduras, abarrotes, artículos de aseo y frutas. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 2 años y medio. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de verduras con un puesto en ferias libres, Ingrid viene de una familia de comerciantes, por lo tanto heredó el oficio.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas, distribuidoras y en la vega de Lo Valledor (Feria libre con productos y costos convenientes para comerciantes). Su horario de trabajo es de 7ºº de la mañana a 7ºº de la tarde de lunes a viernes, durante el fin de semana éste horario se extiende hasta las 11ºº de la noche. 
Con el crédito compró mercadería para surtir su negocio, además de materiales de construcción para arreglar el piso de su negocio y la fachada de éste. 
Sus metas en su negocio son ampliar el espacio físico de su negocio para poder abastecerlo con más mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos. Comenta que existen más locales comerciales cerca del suyo, pero señala que no existe competencia. 
Ingrid vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 10 años. Su esposo la ayuda a atender el almacén. 
Sus sueños son que su hijo termine sus estudios de buena manera para que en un futuro sea un profesional. Además tiene planes de comprar la casa en la vive, ya que actualmente la arrienda. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, son para generar mayores ingresos y así poder brindarle a su familia una mejor situación socioeconómica. 
Ingrid está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que existe una muy buena acogida y disposición por parte de la institución. Además comenta que el crédito ha sido fundamental para invertir en su negocio y con esto cumplir sus sueños. 
Cerrillos es una de las 34 comunas que componen la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) y se ubica en el sector sur poniente. Actualmente, existe en la comuna un importante sector industrial y comercial compuesto de más de 1.500 empresas, de gran importancia en la economía local.
texts.en:
Ingrid is part of a communal bank called “Los comerciantes” ("The Traders"), belonging to the community of Cerillos in the city of Santiago. She dedicates herself to the area of sales, specifically to her grocery store, located in her house. Here she sells fruit and vegetables, groceries, and cleaning progucts. She has dedcated her time to this for the past two and a half years. Before that, she sold vegetables from a stall in open air markets. Ingrid comes from a family of business people, from whom she inherited her trade. She buys her stock in wholesale supermarkets, from distributors, and from Lo Valledor (a market on the plain, where the products and prices are geared for selling to traders). Her working hours are from 7am to 7pm Monday to Friday, and she extends her hours until 11pm at weekends.

With the loan she has bought stock for her business, and construction materials with which to fix the floor and facade of the premises. Her goals for her business are to increase the physical space she has, to be able to stock it with more goods and thus increase her income. She comments that there are other commercial outlets nearby, but indicates that there is no direct competition.

Ingrid lives with her husband and her 10 year old son. Her husband helps run the shop. Her dream is that her son will complete his studies successfully so as to have a professional career. She also has plans to buy the house in which they live, because at present they rent it. Her motivation for continuing to build her business is to generate greater income and that way to offer her family a better socio-economic situation. 

Ingrid is very happy and grateful for the support offered by Fondo Esperanza (the field partner); there is a very positive ethos within that institution. She also comments that the loan has been vital to investing in her business and making her dreams come true. 

Cerillos is one of 34 communities which comprise the metropolitan area around Santiago (the capital of Chile), and is locates in the south west. At present, there is an important industrial and commercial sector in the town. This is composed of more than 1500 businesses and makes an important contribution to the local economy.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business, and materials to repair the floor and facade of the building her business occupies.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Cienaga Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta es casada, tiene 40 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 D. los cuales está estudiando la educación primaria, se dedica al bordado D. blusas y a la crianza D. animales, inicio este negocio D. bordado por iniciativa ropa y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitara un préstamo que le servirá para la compra D. materiales para bordado, es ese caso para la compra D. lustrina y así poder contar con mas capital para el bordad D. blusas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a diversas actividades: bordado D. blusas, venta D. ropa y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Señora Marta is married. She is 40 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are attending primary school. She dedicates her time to embroidering blouses and to raising animals. She started her embroidery business on her own initiative and now has 5 years of experience.

She decided to organise a group to be able to seek a loan that will be used to purchase embroidery materials, in this case silk or satin fabrics, so as to have more capital for the blouse embroidery business.

The other members of the group dedicate their time to a range of activities: embroidering blouses, clothing sales, and raising animals.

loans.use: To buy silk fabrics.

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la señora Matilde. Este grupo se formo hace varios años y es la quinta vez que estan retirando el préstamo de la fundación  siempre fue un grupo muy tranquilo que solucionaban los problemas si es que existía solo entre ellas, pero van progresando.
La señora Matilde es la presidenta del grupo y siempre supo sobrellevar su cargo, es muy responsable. Ella se define a si misma como una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, a la cual le gusta trabajar, ya que desde muy pequeña ha trabajado y ese mismo espíritu de laboriosidad es lo que quiere transmitir a sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo tales como las ropas blusas, jeans,  camperas y también agujas , hilos , telas, etc.
Este grupo es muy unido y luchador, tienen mucha fe de que este crédito les ayudara mucho con sus proyectos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Señora Matilde. The group was formed several years ago, and this is the fifth time they have drawn a loan from the Foundation. They have always been a peaceful group who are able to resolve amongst themselves any problems that may arise, and they go on progressing. 

Señora Matilde is the president of the group and always knows how to manage what she is charged with: she is very responsible. She defines herself as a very determined and enterprising woman, who likes to work. She has worked ever since she was very young and this same work ethic is what she would like to pass on to her children. She is seeking the loan to buy the materials necessary for her work: clothing such as blouses, jeans and jackets, and also needles, thread, cloth etc.

The group is very united and determined. They have great faith that this loan will help them very much with their projects.

loans.use: To buy the materials necessary for her work - clothing such as blouses, jeans, and jackets, and also needles, thread, cloth, etc.

loans.name: V. Jonas

texts.fr: Né le 5 avril 1984 au Bénin, Jonas est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple à trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Jonas vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Jonas assure avec sa femme les différentes charges de la maison. Jonas a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Jonas mène comme activité depuis neuf ans la décoration. Pour exercer convenablement ce métier, Jonas a besoin de fournitures de décoration (peinture, encre etc.). Jonas s’approvisionne alors au Nigéria et au Togo, tous États voisins du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Jonas sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born on April 5, 1984 in Bénin, Jonas is married to Béatrice, a merchant.  The couple has three children in their care; two are their own children.  Some of the children are in school.  Jonas lives with his wife and children.  With his wife, he provides for the household expenses.  Jonas attended school up to high school.  To provide for his needs and those of his children, Jonas has been running a decoration business for nine years.  To practice this profession properly, Jonas needs decoration supplies (paint, ink etc.).   He gets his supplies in Nigeria and Togo, neighboring states of Bénin.  This business generates income that helps him take care of the family’s various expenses.  Jonas is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to expand his business and increase his profit.

loans.use: To buy cans of paint and ink.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past seven years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market and from door to door to her neighbours. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of owning a well furnished café in the business.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase utensils, plates, jugs, cups, spoons and cooking pots. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, plates, jugs, cups, spoons and cooking pots.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children and they all go to school. She works in Ndeeba market selling charcoal and has been doing the same business for the last eight years. Rose takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother).

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO in order to buy more bags of charcoal. Rose sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. 

Her business challenges include transportation, ever increasing prices of charcoal and the rainy season which makes movement difficult.    Rose aspires to see her business grow big so that she can get enough profits to buy herself a delivery van and also to sell wholesale only. Rose lives in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, medications and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres denominado "Mujeres Unidas" se originó a través de iniciativa de ellas mismas de unirse y trabajar en forma solidaria por el bien de cada una de sus compañeras.
El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo,fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. Desean poder lograr el mayor bienestar para  todas las miembros del grupo. Se definen como mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras, pero por sobre todo emprendedoras.
La sra. Obdulia, la presidenta del grupo, realiza actividades como elaboración y venta de minutas y dulces caceros a fin de aumentar sus ingresos familiares. Sueña con poder aumentar la variedad de productos que ella ofrece a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de todos aquellos ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de sus alimentos como ser la carne, las especias y demás cosas.
El deseo de ella es que todas las integrantes cuente con una actividad y tengan ingresos para la manutención de sus familias, para darles una vida digna.
texts.en:
The group of women known as "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) began through their own initiative, when they decided to join up and work together for the benefit of each and every one of their number. Each woman's objective is to work as a team, build a spirit of solidarity, and reach the highest level of the programme. They want to be able to achieve the highest standard of living for all the members of the group. They define themselves as very determined, hard-working, and - above all - enterprising, women.

Señora Obdulia, the president of the committee, makes and sells cold drinks and homemade sweets to supplement her family's income. She would love to be able to increase the variety of products she offers her customers. She is seeking the loan to buy all the ingredients she will need to prepare her dishes, such as meat and spices among other things. 

Her wish is that all the members of the group have work and generate income to support their families, to give them a life of dignity.

loans.use: To buy all the ingredients she needs to make her dishes - such as meat, spices and other things.

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina mujeres maravillas, fue creado a iniciativa de la Sra. Adelaida, ya que esta tiene un gran visión, así que decidió motivar a sus vecinas del barrio para que formen un comité que les permitan sentirse útiles, no solo a ellas sino también a sus familias, aportando para el pan de cada día. Actualmente son un grupo de 17 señoras que participan activa y solidariamente.
La Sra. Adelaida es la directora de finanzas del comité, ella se define como una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable, por lo que lleva con orgullo el puesto que posee. Ademas de ser la directora de finanzas, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, desde hace ya un bien tiempo, por lo que ya posee un numero de clientas bien definido, por lo mismo, sueña con poder comprar mas cosméticos para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas cosméticos que la ayudara para poder aumentar la diversidad de mercaderías, pues sabe que teniendo mas variedad podrá atraer mas gente.
texts.en: This committee, who call themselves "Mujeres Maravillas" ("Wonder Women"), was created on the initiative of Señora Adelaida. With great vision, she decided to motivate the other women in the neighbourhood to form a committee that would help them feel they were making a difference: something that was not just for themselves but also for their families, and that would put bread on the table. They are now a group of 17 women who participate actively and in solidarity. Señora Adelaida is the committee's finance director. She defines herself as an enterprising and very responsible woman, who holds her position with pride. As well as being the finance director, she dedicates herself to selling cosmetics. She has been doing this for a good while now and so she has a solid customer base. She would love to be able to buy more cosmetics, and so have a greater variety to offer these same customers. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of more cosmetics. This will help her increase her range of products, as she knows that with greater variety she should be abe to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa  is a single mother of  five children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members.

Kasifa owns a retail shop at Busega. She has been in business for four years and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.  Kasifa has requested a loan of 1,100,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more stock for her shop.  Kasifa lives in a home that she rents and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: El Sol X Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es "EL SOL X", nombre que adoptaron porque “El Sol”, tiene un significado importante pues emite luz y energia además el nombre las motiva a seguir iluminando y dando prosperidad y constancia a sus vidas. El grupo se localiza en estado de Puebla, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 09 integrantes. La señora PATRICIA, es la Presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 46 años de edad y estudio unicamente la preparatoria. Vende Cajas de madera en las cuales guardan y transportan frutas y verduras, ella es casada y tiene una hija  de 15 años. La señora es reconocida por sus compañeras por ser una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha ido progresando desde hace 18 años, el prestamo lo requiere para invertir mas en su negocio y comprar por mayoreo cajas para fruta que les vende a los comerciantes de frutas y verduras que le hacen compras de grandes cantidades para toda su mercancia. Con las ganancias quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ahorrar para la educación de sus hija pues su gran sueño es verla como profesionista, tambien desea apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en: The name of this group is "El Sol X", a name that they adopted because "El Sol" (the sun) has an important significance because it emits light and energy. Additionally, the name motivates them to continue illuminating and giving prosperity and constancy to their lives. The group is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico. The group is made up of 9 members. Patricia is the president of the group. She is 46 years old and only finished high school. She sells wooden boxes in which fruits and vegetables are stored and transported. She is married and has a daughter who is 15. She is recognized by her colleagues for being a responsible person and she has gotten ahead in the face of adversity, being a native of this community, she has been progressing for 18 years. She needs the loan to invest more in her business and to purchase at wholesale boxes for fruit that she sells to fruit and vegetable vendors and that she buys in great quantities for their merchandise. With the earnings, she wishes to continue investing in her business and save for her daughter's education since her great dream is to see her become a professional. Also, she wishes to support her husband with the home expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale boxes for fruit.

loans.name: Sossou Moussiliou

texts.fr: Né le 12 avril 1976 au Bénin, Sossou Moussiliou est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Adidjatou. Le couple à dix enfants dont huit sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont encore à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Sossou Moussiliou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants.
