Sossou Moussiliou assure avec sa femme les différentes charges de la maison. Sossou Moussiliou a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Sossou Moussiliou mène comme activité, la vente de sable lagunaire depuis près de cinq ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sossou Moussiliou fait le transport des passagers. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Sossou Moussiliou sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born on April 12, 1976 in Benin, Sossou Moussilou is married to Adidjatou, a vendor. The spouses are raising 10 children, eight of whom are their own. All children are still in their care. Some of the children go to school. Sossou Moussiliou lives together with his wife and children. He and his wife jointly provide for different household needs. Sossou Moussilou stopped school at the primary level. In order to support himself and his children, Sossou Moussilou has been selling lagoon sand for almost five years. In addition to this business, he works as a driver and transports passengers. This allows him to earn an income to cover various family expenses. With the view of expanding his business and growing his income, Sossou Moussilou is seeking his first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy lagoon sand

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with eight children and five are school going.  She takes care of one additional family member.

Getrude owns a retail shop in Ndeeba.  She has been in business for less than a year and sell to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Gertrude has requested a loan of 800,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more stock for her retail shop and to build her own shop. Gertrude lives in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la Sra Celestina, de Ciudad del Este, tuvo mucha influencia, ya que ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas, y las motivo para formar el comité en la Zona donde viven.
El comité se Denomina “Tajy Poty”  están en el Noveno  Ciclo   con  18   integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, las mismas realizan labores de incentivos y ayudan en su comunidad con las tareas sociales.
La Sra. Celestina, se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace ya varios años, por lo que ya ha conseguido una clientela bien definida, pero piensa que si tiene un poco mas de dinero podrá comprar mas perfumes con lo que lograra tener mas variedad de productos, con lo que atraerá a mas clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevos tipos de perfumes, con lo cual podrá renovar y sumar a los que ya tiene para poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
For the formation of the committee, Celestina, from the city of Este, had a lot of influence since she contacted her neighbors and friends and motivated them to form the committee in the area where they live.

The committee named "Tajy Poty" is in its ninth cycle with 18 members. It is a group that is distinguished in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible. They perform incentive work and help their community with social work. Celestina has been dedicated to selling perfume for many years for which she has already acquired a well-defined customer base. However, she thinks that if she had a little more money she would be able to buy more perfumes with which she could have a greater variety of products which would attract more customers. She is requesting the loan to buy new types of perfumes with which she will be able to renew and add to what she already has to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes to renew the stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es: Nicolasa, trabajadora, ama de casa y a su vez emprendedora tiene un ingreso económico de su negocio venta de ropa por minorista, casada, tiene estudiando a su hijo. Tiene el negocio desde hace un tiempo e iniciándolo con fondo propios de ahorros que tenía. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería: ropa para damas, caballeros, niños. Logrando aumentar inventarió y obteniendo mayores utilidades al ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a hard-working housewife who is also an entrepreneur.  She makes income from her business selling clothes retail.  Nicolasa is married and her son is in school.  She has owned her business for some time.  She started it with some savings that she had put aside.

Nicolasa will invest this loan in buying merchandise: ladies', men's and children's clothes.  This will help her to increase her inventory and make more profits as she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Eusebia Paulina

texts.es:
Eusebia de 47 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Su actividad es la venta de comida.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás vendiendo de poco a poco sus almuerzos y después fue creciendo con el tiempo hasta llegar a tener una buena clientela. Ella labora diariamente con su hermana desde en la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo de casa y local. En un futuro desea tener un buen negocio para lograr una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 47 years old and lives in an urban area of Las Orquídeas (which is so called because there were originally a lot of orchids to be found there), in Guayaquil.  She is single and has two children.  Her business is selling meals.

Eusebia started her business some time ago, selling lunches.  Over time, she grew her business and she now has a good customer base.  She works every day with her sister, from the morning until two in the afternoon.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy building supplies to fix up her house and business premises.  In the future, she would like to have a good business so that she achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Ma Cristina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Ma. Cristina le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y el piso de concreto al frente de su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es pintura para el exterior, comprar de cemento, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Ella se dedica al cuidado de sus dos hijos que tiene y su esposo el señor Salvador es quien se encarga de los gastos familiares, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de una compañía, como vendedor.
texts.en:
María Cristina's home needs some finishing work done on the outside and also on the concrete floor out front.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials.  She will buy paint for the outside of the house and also cement and sand.  In addition, she will pay the person who will carry out these improvements.

María Cristina looks after her two children and her husband, Salvador, takes care of the family expenses with the wage that he earns in his job as an employee in a company.  He works as a salesman.

loans.use: to have some finishing work done to the outside of her home and on a concrete floor

loans.name: Luz America

texts.es:
Luz de 49 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de comidas.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás por medio de la gente de su sector que ponga un negocio de comida ya que no había por su barrio. Labora sola desde las 5H00 pm a 10H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para adecuar su vivienda y tener un espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old and lives in Primavera, Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city which was originally built upon without official permission.  The area has several hills, streams and lakes which are still visible as the remains of a broken ecology).  Luz is single and her business is selling meals.

Luz started her business some time ago.  She set up the business because there was no food business in her neighborhood.  She works alone from 5.00pm to 10.00pm.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy building supplies to fix up her home, so that she can have a space for her business.

loans.use: to buy sand and blocks to finish fixing up her home

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Victoriano tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos adolescentes, que se encuentran estudiando.
El Sr. Victoriano se dedica hace aproximadamente 25 años a la fabricación de muebles de todo tipo, se inició en las tareas de carpintería desde muy joven, gracias a que su padre lo había iniciado en esta hermosa profesión.
Actualmente realiza los trabajos a todas aquellas personas que le solicitan sus servicios, además realiza trabajos tercerizados para arquitectos e ingenieros. Esta muy orgulloso del trabajo que realiza y desea que sus hijos también se dediquen a una profesión similar a la suya.
Solicita el crédito para ampliar una parte de su galpón o taller de trabajo, ademas de aquellos materiales inherentes a su profesion, ya que se inicia la temporada de invierno y necesita resguardar sus productos terminados.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 45 years old.  He is single and has two teenage children who are in school.

Victoriano has been making all kinds of furniture for approximately 25 years.  He began doing carpentry work at a very young age thanks to his father who started him off in this beautiful profession.

Victoriano is currently doing work for everybody who requests his services.  He also does outsourced work for architects and engineers.  He is very proud of the work that he does and would like his children to carry out a profession similar to his.

Victoriano is requesting this loan to expand part of his workshop, as well as to buy materials that he needs for his profession.  The winter season is starting and he needs to protect his finished products.

loans.use: to expand his workshop and buy tools he needs for his carpentry business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with eight children and four of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Mary sells charcoal. She has been in business for seven years and sells to all categories both retail and wholesale.

Mary has requested a loan of 800,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more charcoal and to build her own stall.  Mary lives in a home that she rents and her family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, schoolfees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with five children and all her children go to school .She has no additional family members .Deborah sells charcoal. She has been in business for the last 10 years and sells to all categories at both retail and wholesale .Deborah has requested 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more charcoal and build her own stall. Deborah lives in a home that she doesn’t rent and her family has access to electricity and piped water .Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Eudiber Cristobal

texts.es:
Eudiber de 51 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposa le ayuda con el negocio y tienen dos hijos que estudian en colegios fiscales. Tiene una tienda de víveres.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás cuando se cambio de domicilio decidió abrir una tienda para su clientela . Labora de 6H00 am a 10H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas víveres para sus ventas y surtir mas el negocio. En un futuro desea comprarse otra casa para alquilarlo y tener otros incremento en su capital.
texts.en:
51 year-old Eudiber lives in Primavera, Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city that was originally built upon without official authorization.  The area has several hills, streams and lakes that are visible as the remains of a broken ecology).  Eudiber's wife helps him in his business and they have two children who are in public (state) schools.

Eudiber has a grocery store.  He started his business some time ago when he moved house.  He decided to open a store for his customers.  He works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  With the help of this loan, Eudiber would like to buy more food products to sell, so that he can better stock his store.  In the future, he would like to buy another house to rent out and increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks and candy

loans.name: Adjimon Angèle

texts.fr: Née en 1977 au Bénin, Adjimon Angèle est mariée à Bienvenu, un chauffeur. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Adjimon Angèle et son mari. Pour participer efficacement aux devoirs de mère de famille qui est le sien, Adjimon Angèle vend depuis huit ans, du charbon de bois, des balaies artisanaux et des céréales et huile végétale de façon secondaire. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Adjimon Angèle sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. Adjimon Angèle avait bien remboursé les crédits reçus antérieurement.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Benin, Adjimon Angèle is married to Bienvenu, a driver. They have 5 children, and are responsible for all of them. Some of the children have received an education. The couple live together with their children, and Adjimon Angèle and her husband take care of the various household expenses together. 

For the last 8 years, Adjimon Angèle has sold charcoal, hand-crafted brooms and cereals, as well as vegetable oil to a lesser extent. This allows her to carry out her duties as a mother to her family.  With the goal of increasing her business and keeping up with customer demand, Adjimon Angèle is asking ALIDé for a fifth loan. She has properly repaid the loans she has already received.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, brooms and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha tiene ya más de dos años con su negocio de salón de belleza.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder remodelar los acabados del local del interior como es comprar pintura, espejos, y muebles. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar las mejorar que a su negocio le esta haciendo falta. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. 
Desea tener su negocio en mejor condición para su clientes estén cómodos y a gusto mientras ellas los esta atendiendo.
texts.en:
Bertha has run her beauty salon business for more than two years.  She is requesting a loan to remodel the inside of her premises, buying paint, mirrors and furniture.  Right now, she does not have the money she needs to carry out these improvements that her business lacks.

Bertha plans to repay her loan with some of the profits that she makes in her business since it is her family's source of income.  She is a single mother and has one child in her care.

Bertha would like her business to be in a better condition so that her customers feel comfortable and at ease while she is attending to them.

loans.use: to have some work done to the inside of her premises and to buy materials

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Née en 1960 au Bénin, Edith est mariée à un certain Victor. Le couple à six enfants dont cinq restent encore à  leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Edith et son mari. Pour participer efficacement aux devoirs de mère de famille qui est le sien, Edith vend depuis sept ans, des bois de chauffage. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère de revenu, Edith vend du maïs. Edith s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Edith sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. Edith avait obtenu antérieurement quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Bénin, Edith is married to Victor. The couple have six children of whom five are still dependent on their support. Some of the children are enrolled in school. The couple live together with their children. The various household expenses are assumed by Edith and her husband. 

To assume her role as wife and mother efficiently, Edith has been selling firewood for seven years. Alongside this income-generating business, Edith sells maize. She buys her supplies in one of the marketplaces of Bénin. Wishing to expand her business and better respond to the demand of her clientele, Edith is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. She was granted four prior loans that were all correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood and maize.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El señor Dario tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Eusebia, tienen 8 hijos, 7 mujeres ya mayores de edad y 1 varon en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Ita. El se considera un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, no teme trabajar para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para poder vivir decorosa y dignamente.
El Sr. Dario realiza diversas actividades comerciales desde muy joven, posee un horno propio donde produce y vende carbón en su domicilio, también posee 3 carritos con caballo que utilizan sus hijas para la venta de sus productos.
El señor Dario ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, sacrificada y emprendedora, gracias a eso ayudó a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar, ser trabajadores y responsables.
Solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus hornos de carbón y para reparación de los carritos, piensa que este crédito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Dario, age 49, is married to Eusebia, and they have eight children.  Seven of the children are girls, and they are now adults.  The other child is a school age boy.  They live in the city of Ita.  He is considered to be a very responsible and hard-working father.  He is not afraid to work in order to be able to give his family all of the necessities.  That way they are able to live in a suitable and decent way.

Dario has engaged in diverse commercial activities since he was very young.  He has his own oven where he produces and sells charcoal at his home.  He also has three horse drawn carts, and his daughters use them to sell their products.

Dario has demonstrated himself to be a responsible, self-sacrificing, and enterprising person.  Thanks to this, he helped his children so that they could go to school and become hard-working and responsible people.

He is requesting the loan for maintenance on his charcoal ovens and to repair the carts.  He thinks this loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his charcoal ovens and his carts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trays of fresh eggs.

loans.name: Jaime Alonzo

texts.es:
Jaime de 57 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene en la actualidad un taller de autos donde pinta de distintos colores y preferencias los vehículos de sus clientes. 

Tiene trabajando en el negocio de pintura 20 años, esto le ayudo a mantener a su familia ya que tiene tres hijos. En la actualidad tiene un oficial que le ayuda den el negocio. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir con su taller por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar una sopladora, compresores y herramientas para pintar con mas tecnológica los autos.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 57, is a hard-working man.  He currently has an auto shop where he paints vehicles different colors according to his customers’ preferences.  He has been working in the business of painting for 20 years.  This helps him support his family; he has three children.  

He currently has a worker who helps him in the business.  He has many aspirations to continue with his shop. That is why he wants the loan to buy a blower, compressors, and tools in order use more technology to paint the cars.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, millet, and sugar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Fatuma has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products from home by means of retail. Fatuma has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of  charcoal. The main business challenges for Fatuma are transportation and defaulters. Her goal is to expand the business so that she can build rental rooms. Fatuma lives in a house that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Lumière De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LUMIERE DE DIEU est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à une même association d'artisanat. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Frédéric est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Frédéric est né le six juin 1970 au Bénin et est marié à Célestine une revendeuse . Le couple à six enfants qui sont encore tous à leur charge.Cinq représentent leurs propres enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Frédéric vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses  enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Frédéric n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Après avoir arrêté l'école, Frédéric a appris le métier de couture.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants Frédéric exerce la couture depuis environ quinze ans. Parallèlement à cette activité Frédéric vend des noix de palmier à huile. Frédéric s’approvisionne en fournitures de couture dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Frédéric sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LUMIERE DE DIEU, un deuxième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "Lumière de Dieu" (God's Light) is composed of three people who are members of the same trade association. It is the second time that the group applies for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé in order to boost its activity level. The representative of the group, Frédéric, is raising his hand on the photo. Frédéric was born in Benin on June 6, 1970 and is married to Célestine, a merchant. The spouses have six children who all are still supported by them. Five of them are their own children. Some of the children attend school. Frédéric lives together with his wife and the children. The spouses share the various household expenses. Frédéric attended only elementary school. When he left school, he learnt the dressmaking trade.

Frédéric has been in the dressmaking business for 15 years and could provide for his needs and those of his children. Next to his activity, he sells nuts of oil palms. Frédéric gets his supply of sewing articles at a market in Benin. Eager to satisfy the needs of their customers and increase their turnover and income, Frédéric and his fellow members of the group "Lumière de Dieu" applied for their second loan. They have repaid their previous loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy sewing articles.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 30 años, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco,  vive en su propia morada al lado de su pareja Efraín de 33 años y sus 02 queridos hijos José de 05 años y Roció de de 02 años de edad a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación para que en un futuro próximo sean hombres de gran provecho. Ruth es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su casta familiar. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra sobre sus tierras, achiote, palillo, café y cacao. Ha realizado esta actividad durante 18 años con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró media hectárea de terreno para seguir cultivando. Por otro lado compró maquinas fumigadoras para el control de la  plaga de insectos. Considera que este trabajo demanda mucho esfuerzo, por ello cuando se trata de limpiar y cosechar tiene que contratar peones para que le ayuden con este trabajo  ya que debe seleccionarlos y prepararlos para ser llevados hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad e San Francisco y Quimbiri donde recibe buena paga por los granos que produce. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo. Tiene planeado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café es por ello que acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante   a sus adorados hijos. Este será el crédito número 06 con MFP, es por ello espera del apoyo de los financistas para poder concretar sus planes y por ende se compromete a devolver  puntualmente los pagos. En su banco comunal ocupa el cargo de presidente quien vela por el progreso de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café.
texts.en:
Ruth, age 30, is from the city of San Francisco.  She lives in her own home with her life partner, 33 year old Efraín, and their two beloved children.  José is 5, and Roció is 2.  She wishes to provide them with a good education so that in the near future they will become useful people.

Ruth is a woman who works arduously.  Every day she strives to give the best of herself to her household.  She works in agriculture.  She plants annatto, palillo (a condiment), coffee, and cacao on her land.  She has been doing this very carefully and laboriously for 18 years.   Thanks to the profits from her plants, she bought a half of a hectare of land in order to continue growing her crops.  

In addition to this, she bought fumigation machines to control pest infestations.  She feels that this work demands a lot of effort.  Therefore, when it is time to clear the fields and harvest she hires workers to help her with the work.  They need to pick the crops and prepare them to be taken to the collection centers.  The centers are in the cities of San Franscisco and Quimbirii, where she gets good payment for the grains she produces.  

She has some land that she does not cultivate.  It inevitably needs the support of the financial institution in order to carry on with her work.  She plans to plant her farmland with more coffee plants.  That is why she goes for the loans that the MFP institution facilitates for people with little resources who are looking to progress.

She hopes to have her characteristic strength and impetus in order to do good work to get her adorable children ahead.  This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She hopes to have the support of the lenders in order to be able to make her plans a reality.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She is the president of her communal bank, and she watches over the members’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Atia's Group

texts.en:
Atia is a married woman. She is a caring lady by nature. She takes care of her family and makes the utmost effort in providing comfort to them by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is involved in the bicycle repair business. He also sells bicycle spare parts to buyers who come to him for them. He has been in this trade for many years. He is an expert in his work and has a good reputation among his customers for his good services. 

Atia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy repair tools and other bicycle spare parts so he can provide better service and increasing his profits. 

Atia is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further after making an investment in it and her family will be able to enjoy a better financial life as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Atia.

loans.use: To buy repair tools and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty  is a single mother of six, and only three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Betty has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for over ten years. Betty works seven days a week and sells her products by retail. She works from home and works seven days out of every week. Her business challenges include transportation, the rainy season, which makes roads impassable, and also increases in the price of charcoal. Betty aspires to owning a delivery van. She resides in a two-room house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married, with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional dependents. Grace owns a retail shop in Ndeeba. She has been in business for the last eight years and sells both retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Grace has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more stock for her retail shop and build her own shop. Grace lives in a house that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerry cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina de 40 años, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco. Vive en su propia casa en el caserío de Limonchayocc junto a su pareja Edgar de 42 años y sus 04 queridos hijos quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente. Marcelina vive en las verdes praderas de su centro poblado, donde respira viento fresco y rodeado de la fauna y flora silvestre que la mantienen con gran fortaleza para trabajar con más ahínco en sus tierras. Ahí cultiva plantas nativas de la zona selvática peruana, como cítricos, cacao y café productos que logró trabajarlos con mucha entrega para que sean muy fructíferos. Marcelina viene arando sus tierras desde sus 18 años y hoy es toda una conocedora de la ardua labor que se ejerce en el campo agrícola. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de productos ella necesariamente tiene que contratar peones para apresurar su trabajo. A ella le encanta su trabajo por que gracias a ello compró varios muebles para su hogar y también adquirió dos hectáreas más de terreno para sembrar. Marcelina solicita el crédito para fortalecer sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas  razón por la cual acude a los créditos que MFP facilita. En adelante para el bien de su economía comprará nuevas tierras  y seguirá cultivando con el mismo empeño que la caracteriza. Este será su sexto crédito por la cual se siente muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados. Con el  crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, de esa manera sus plantas lucirán mas frondosos.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years old and originally from the city of San Francisco. She lives in her own home in the village of Limonshayocc with her partner Edgar, age 42, and their four children who inspire her to continue working hard. Marcelina resides in the green pastures of the village center where one can breathe fresh air and be surrounded by animal and plant life. By maintaining her strength, Marcelina is able to work with great effort on her land. She grows crops that are native to the Peruvian jungle such as citrus fruits, cacao, and coffee. Her harvest is very productive because of her dedication. Marcelina has been farming for 18 years and is an expert at working hard in the fields. During the harvest season, she needs to hire workers in order to speed up the work. She enjoys her job and the income she earns has allowed her to buy furniture for her home and acquire two more hectares of land for planting.

Marcelina is requesting this loan to strengthen her farm so that she can gain more productive returns. For this reason, she has utilized the loans that MFP provides. Going forward, she hopes to buy additional farmland to improve her financial situation and continue farming with the same level of determination. This will be her sixth loan and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support. Marcelina feels confident that she can buy the things she needs and is willing to submit her loan payments on time. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer so that her crops can thrive.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Liliana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Liliana tiene 26 años de edad,es soltera trabaja en un fundo de la cuidad como obrera de campo, viene realizando esta labor por mas de 5 años ademas tiene otros ingresos como vendedora  de productos de belleza de diversos catalagos,los desafios que enfrenta liliana es tener que salir todas las tardes a ofrecer sus productos,el dinero del prestamos sera invertido en comprar mas productos como perfumes talcos maquillaje entre otros, ademas de una vitrina para mostrar dicha mercaderia para la campaña por el dia del padre. Liliana tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es hacer crecer mas su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y construir su casa de material noble, liliana esta muy contente con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Sra. Liliana is 26 years old, single, and works as a field laborer at a local farm. She has worked at this job for more than five years, but she also earns additional income selling beauty products from different catalogs. The challenges Liliana faces include setting aside time every afternoon to sell her products. The money from her loans has been invested in the purchase of more products such as perfumes, talcum powders, makeup, and other items. She will take this opportunity to also acquire a display cabinet for storing her merchandise to be sold for Father’s Day.

Liliana has many dreams which include expanding her business, improving her quality of life, and building a house out of solid materials. She is very pleased to have the trust that was demonstrated to her through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, talcum powders, makeup, and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic ware and beads

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a single mother with eight children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She operates a retail shop in Kawala where she works seven days a week. She has been in this business for over ten years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerry cans of cooking oil, and bags of maize flour and baking flour. Enid sells to all categories of people on retail. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Enid aspires to seeing her business grow big so that she owns a wholesale shop, and also to buying a plot of land so that she can build her own house. Enid decided to join MCDT because of the low interest rates compared to other MFIs.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es: Uldarico de 30 años de edad, natural de la comunidad de Limonchayocc caserío de la ciudad de San Francisco, Uldarico convive con Consuelo de 28 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos y habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina. Uldarico con tanto cuidado logró reanudar sus parcelas en áreas verdes, rodeado de arboles frondosos a la vez cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y frutos de piña, donde viene realizando su actividad desde hace 12 años con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Uldarico menciona que desde muy niño aprendió a arar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres y hoy trabaja sus propias tierras. Su producto mas rentable es la venta de café, porque los vende en cantidad  y a un buen precio,  y gracias a las ganancias adquiridas logró comprar animales de carga, como burros para facilitarse con el traslado de sus productos. Durante los meses de Junio a Agosto son tiempos donde mayormente siembra todo tipo de plantas, razón por la cual Uldarico acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar sus crédito y poder sembrar mas plantas de café y frutos de piña. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza que convive su familia. Este será su sexto crédito y está muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero de parte de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado. En su banco comunal es un socio solidario y vela por el progreso de su grupo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de café y piña.
texts.en:
Uldarico is 30 years old and a native of the village community of Limonchayocc in the city of San Francisco. He is in a common-law marriage with Conseulo, age 28, and their relationship resulted in two children. They live in their own home made of basic materials such as wood and tin. Uldarico carefully manages his parcels of green farmland surrounded by lush trees. He grows cacao, coffee, and pineapples. Uldarico has been farming for 12 years with the help of day laborers. He says that as a young boy he learned from his parents how to plow the land. Today he works on his own property. The product that is most profitable is the sale of coffee because he is able to sell in bulk and at a good price. With the profits he earned Uldarico was able to buy domesticated animals, such as donkeys, for transporting his products. The period from June to August is when he can plant all types of crops. For this reason, Uldarico approached MFP to request a loan so that he can sow more coffee and pineapple plants. His plans are to continue farming and acquiring more land so that his family can overcome poverty.

This will be his sixth loan and he is pleased to know that he has everyone’s support. Uldarico is confident that he can move forward with his plans. He is a supportive member of his Communal Bank and helps to oversee the progress of his group. This loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy coffee and pineapple seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Yao Antoine

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 31ans. Yao  est revendeur de friperie (habits importés de l’occident) depuis 1998. Il achète au marché d’ASSIYEYE et revend au même lieu. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et assurer sa future vie maritale.
texts.en: A 31-year-old young man, Yao has been a retailer of second-hand clothing (imported from the West) since 1998. He makes his purchases at the ASSIYEYE market and re-sells at the same location. He is requesting this loan to bolster his business and to ensure a life of marriage in the future.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter de 58 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Alto Yapas (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia  junto a Esperanza, su esposa desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Según cuenta la agricultura es su principal actividad económica, le sirvió para poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, de los cuales se refiere con mucho orgullo; pues heredaron su oficio. En sus 15 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café y plátanos, aprendió a invertir y distribuir de buena manera su dinero. Ahora con mucho orgullo, resume que es uno de los mejores agricultores de la zona. En cada cosecha de café vende sus granos maduros a una empresa de producción de café muy reconocida de la zona, donde obtiene muy buenas ganancias, las que le ayudaron a poner una tienda de comestibles en un pequeño espacio de su casa, donde también vende productos de primera necesidad. Y es que el trabajo arduo, es el lema de Walter, quien además posee un pequeño taller de carpintería donde fabrica muebles y demás productos a base de madera. Ahora él quiere invertir en mejorar su negocio, para poder descansar en su vejez. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Walter, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra un motor nuevo para renovar su máquina de carpintería.
texts.en:
Walter is 58 years old and resides in the native community of Alto Yapas in the central Peruvian jungle.  He lives there with Esperanza, his wife of 30 years.  They have two children who they care for in their own home.  His main business activity is farming since it has enabled him to move his two children forward.  He is very proud of this accomplishment.   Walter inherited his livelihood and has 15 years of experience growing coffee and bananas.  He has learned how to invest and spend his money in a good way.  Walter is very gratified to know that he is one of the best farmers in the area.  After each harvest, he sells his coffee beans to the most-recognized coffee production company in the area and is able to obtain very good earnings.  This has helped him establish a small grocery store in his house where he sells basic necessities.  Walter’s life is all about hard work.  He also operates a small carpentry shop where he makes furniture and other products out of wood.  Now he wants to invest in this business so that he can improve it and be more comfortable in his old age.  

Walter is a member of the Communal Bank “El Palomar al Éxito”.  This will be his fourth loan with MFP.  He hopes to be able to accomplish his goals with this small loan.  Once again, he promises to complete his payments just as he did with his previous loans.  In addition, he is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  With the money he requested, Walter will purchase a new replacement motor for one his carpentry machines.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor for a machine that is used in his carpentry business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga forma parte del banco comunal “Los comerciantes” perteneciente a la comuna de Cerrillos, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende una carnicería, ésta se encuentra en su domicilio, ya que al pagar por el arriendo de un local los costos se encarecen. 
Su marido es jubilado desde hace 5 años y de esa fecha se dedican a éste rubro. Además su marido es el que se encarga de la preparación de sus productos alimenticios tras faenar con el cerdo, entre ellos  arrollados, queso de cabeza y longanizas. Estos productos son realizados por encargo y Dominga los entrega a sus clientes en sus propios domicilios. El horario de trabajo es extenso de 9ºº de la mañana a 9ºº de la noche. 
Con el crédito compró 8 piernas de cerdo y pollo en caja, en una distribuidora de carnes a bajo costo. 
Sus metas son poder abastecer su negocio de mercadería, de ésta manera generar mayores ingresos.
Dominga vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos que ya son adultos. Sus sueños son estabilizarse económicamente, para arreglar la infraestructura de su negocio. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza. El grupo del banco comunal al cual asiste es muy unido y la asesora les ha enseñado a organizar mejor sus negocios, mediante los aprendizajes de ventas y registro de sus gastos. 
Cerrillos es una de las 34 comunas que componen la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) y se ubica en el sector sur poniente. Actualmente, existe en la comuna un importante sector industrial y comercial compuesto de más de 1.500 empresas, de gran importancia en la economía local.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Comerciantes” (The Merchants) which is in the community of Cerrillos in the city of Santiago. She herself is a merchant who manages a butcher shop in her home since the cost of renting a location is expensive.

Her husband retired five years ago and has helped manage her business ever since. Dominga and her husband prepare food products such as pork, head cheese, and sausages. The products are made according to the orders she receives and then she delivers them to the homes of her customers. Her work schedule is from 9am to 9pm.

With this loan, Dominga will buy eight pig legs and a case of chickens at low cost from a meat distributor. Her goals include restocking her business with more inventory so that she can generate additional income. Dominga and her husband live with their two adult children. Her dreams include becoming financially stable and improving the infrastructure of her business. She is very pleased with the support provided by Fondo Esperanza. The members of her Communal Bank are very close and her loan officer has taught them how to better organize their businesses, generate sales, and keep track of their expenses.

Cerrillos is one of the 34 communities that make up the region of Metropolitana, where the Chilean capital of Santiago is located. The southwest section of the region is where Cerrillos is located. This community is a major industrial and commercial area since more than 1500 businesses make their home here, which is of great importance to the local economy.

loans.use: to purchase eight pig legs and a case of chickens.

loans.name: Solidarité 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOLIDARITE 1 est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent toutes à la même association d'artisans. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Lucien, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Lucien est marié à Hélène, un informaticien et a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont ses propres enfants. Parmi ceux-ci, certains sont scolarisés. Lucien a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la photographie, une activité qu'il exerce passionnément depuis une dizaine d'année et qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille sans grande difficulté. Lucien habite ensemble avec sa famille. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Lucien n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigence. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Lucien et les autres membres du groupe SOLIDARITE 1 sollicitent ensemble un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Solidarité 1 Group is composed of three people who are members of the same trade association. The representative of the group, Lucien, is raising his hand on the photo. It is the second time that this group applies for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé in order to boost its activity level. Lucien is married to Hélène who is in computers. He is the father of four children. Three of them are his own children. Some of the children attend school. Lucien enjoyed very little formal schooling, but he learnt photography skills.

Lucien has been working for ten years with great passion in the photography business, which enables him to provide for his family without major difficulties. Lucien lives together with his family. His customers have more and more needs, but Lucien has only limited resources and struggles to meet the needs of his customers as well as he would like to. Due to their limited resources, Lucien and his fellow members of Solidarité 1 Group came to Alidé and applied for their second loan.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 35ans, Afi a commencé par vendre des céréales depuis 1998. Elle s’approvisionne à ANIE et revend au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle a 01 enfant et son mari est gendarme.
texts.en: A 35-year-old woman, Afi began selling grains in 1998. She gets her supplies in ANIE and re-sells at the Akodessewa market. She wants to bolster her business. She has one child, and her husband is a policeman.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is married, with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of any additional family members. Zam sells yellow bananas. She has been in this business for the last ten years, and sells to all categories of customers, both retail and wholesale. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. Zam lives in a house that she rents, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).   

Annet has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    

Annet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to sell.  

The main business challenges for Annet include transportation and ever increasing prices of bananas in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business growing big so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van.   Annet lives in a home that she owns but she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medications.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia Nely

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es   conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió hasta 5to de primaria. 
Junto a su esposo se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales como ovejas alpacas.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su primer préstamo solicitado fue por S/. 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez unidades de ganados: ovejas y alpacas para su respectivo engorde  por cuatro meses para luego venderlos a buen precio.
Su sueño es seguir con los animales y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, las charlas y las ganancias de sus ahorros. 
Debido al intenso sol la fotografía presenta problemas de nitidéz.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Concepción” which is located in the village of Ayrumas Carumas in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. Aurelia has a fifth-grade education.

Together with her husband, Aurelia buys and sells animals such as sheep and alpacas. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN and invested in her business.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Aurelia will buy 10 heads of livestock, including sheep and alpacas. She will fatten these animals for four months before selling them at a good price. Her dream is to continue raising animals so that she can improve her income. What she enjoys about her Communal Bank are the meetings, the seminars, and the interest she earns from her savings.

The photo of Aurelia did not turn out as clear due to the intense sunlight.

loans.use: to purchase 10 heads of livestock, including sheep and alpaca.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter de 26 años, reside en la comunidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Ahí vive al lado de su hijo Jair, de 2 años de edad a quien cuida con mucho amor y esmero. A pesar de su corta edad, él tiene muchas ambiciones, la protección de su hijo, es su prioridad. Por ello comenzó a ganarse la vida con la actividad que le enseñaron desde que era pequeño, que es “la agricultura”, ahí aprendió a sembrar café y plátanos en sus terrenos agrícolas, que le dieron sus padres; que son ahora 4 hectáreas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha, ya que ve reflejado los resultados de tanto esfuerzo en la comercialización de los granos de café a los acopiadores de la ciudad de La Merced, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo cuenta que, los frutos de plátanos que son cosechados cada 15 días, le proporcionan las ganancias del día a día. Ahora él desea, juntar mayor capital de trabajo para poder sembrar mayor cantidad de café, y así poder tener mejores ganancias para brindarle a su hijo los estudios que requieren. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Walter, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café que recientemente sembró.
texts.en:
Walter is 26 years old and resides in the community of Alto Yapaz in the central Peruvian jungle. He lives with his two-year-old son Jair, who he looks after with much love and care. Even though he is young, Walter has many ambitions. Protecting his son is his priority. For this reason, he started to earn his living by utilizing the skills he learned at a young age. His parents taught him how to grow coffee and bananas on their land and now he has four hectares of his own property. What he enjoys most about his job is the harvesting season, which is evident based on his results. He puts great effort into selling his coffee beans to the collection centers in the city of La Merced, where his able to generate good earnings. In addition, he harvests bananas every 15 days to earn more income. Now he wants to acquire more operating capital so that he can plant large quantities of coffee. This will help him generate more income so that he can provide his son with the necessary education.

Walter is a member of the Communal Bank “El Palomar al Éxito” and is receiving his fourth loan from MFP. He hopes that his partnership with the organization will help him achieve his goals. Once again, he promises to complete his payments just as he did with his previous loans. In addition, Walter is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The money he requested will be invested in several sacks of organic fertilizer that will be applied to the coffee seedlings he recently planted.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and chicken

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin  is a single mother of six and only four of her children go to school. She has a business selling fish. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. 

Kevin works at the market. She wants this loan to buy more baskets of  fish to sell retails.  Her business challenges include defaulters, the rainy season and thieves.  Kevin aspires to see her business grow big so that she could go to the family to bring the fish herself and to sell wholesale only. Kevin resides in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos.  Ella tiene estudios de educación superior.
Hace más de un año que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Con éste  nuevo préstamo de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles dinero, piensa incrementar a su capital para comprar arroz, aceite, leche y azúcar.  Arminda nos cuenta que sus productos los vende solo los días domingos en la localidad de Ilave ya que la señora y su esposo trabajan en una institución de la Región.
Su sueño es ser mayorista y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que recibe respecto a la administración de su dinero.
texts.en:
Arminda is a member of the "San Miguel Arcángel II" community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She finished her higher education.

Arminda has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her grocery business.

Arminda plans to use this new loan for 100 soles to increase her capital and buy rice, oil, milk and sugar.  She tells us that she only sells her products on Sundays in the town of Ilave since she and her husband both work in an institution in the region.

Arminda's dream is to become a wholesaler and thereby improve her profits.

What Arminda likes about her community bank are the training sessions that teach her how to manage her money.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Guadalupe de profesion enfermera con mas catorce años, laborando en un hospital capitalino, casada, madre de dos hijos estudiantes. Su objetivo es mejorar su vivienda el cual lo ha venido haciendo con prestamo que Afodenic le ha otorgado en trece ciclos.
Pues ha sido viable ya que son a plazos, en donde demostrado un buen comportamiento de pagos, hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para cambio de techo el cual esta en mal estado.
Materiales a comprar: veinte laminas de zinc, quince perlines, bloques y hierro, cemento para levantar el alero, ante de poner el techo. Sastifecha por que podra dar  a su familia mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a nurse by profession.  She has been working as a nurse for 14 years, in a hospital in the capital.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  Her aim is to improve her home and she has been doing this with loans from Afodenic over the course of thirteen loan cycles.  This has been possible because payments are made in instalments.  She has a good repayment history.

Guadalupe will use this new loan to replace her roof which is in a bad state of repair.  She will buy twenty sheets of corrugated metal, fifteen beams, blocks, iron and also cement which she will use to raise the eaves before she puts the new roof on.  She is happy because she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, beams, bolts, cement, sand and iron to replace her existing roof and raise it higher up

loans.name: Mahudjro 18 Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO 18 est un groupe de trois personnes dont les membres appartiennent au même groupe d’artisans. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 25 Juin 1987 dans une ville du Bénin. Véronique est mariée à un marchand nommé Joseph. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est à leur charge. Aucun enfant n'est scolarisé. Véronique a appris la couture et l'exerce depuis six ans. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à participer aux charges familiales. Parallèlement, Véronique vend des bois de chauffage . Véronique a besoin d'équiper son atelier de couture par l'acquisition d'une nouvelle machine en vue de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est la deuxième fois que Véronique et les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 18 sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Mahudjro 18 is a group composed of three people who are members of the same trade association. The representative of the group, Véronique, who is raising her hand on the photo, was born in a city in Benin on June 25, 1987. Véronique is married to Joseph, a merchant. The spouses have two children, of whom one is supported by them. None of the children attends school.

Véronique learnt the dressmaking trade and has been in this business for six years. Her activity gives her enough income to provide for herself and contribute to household expenses. Next to her activity, she sells firewood. Véronique needs to equip her workshop with a new sewing machine in order to better meet the demand of her customers. It is the second time that Véronique and her fellow members of Mahudjro 18 Group applied for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé to strengthen their working capital and boost their activity level and better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kaaguy Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kaaguy Poty fue conformado gracias a la iniciativa de la Sra. Dali, quien se puso en contacto con la Fundación Paraguaya, ella es técnica Rural, trabaja en la zona y fue quien les contó a sus compañeras acerca de la posibilidad de crédito con el programa de comité de mujeres.
El comité está integrado por 10 mujeres, todas ellas trabajadoras y luchadoras, se dedican a la elaboración de alimentos como minutas, chipas, sandwish y demás. Ellas cada día se encargan de la elaboración y venta de los alimentos que preparan.
Estas señoras han manifestado que esta es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito a Fundación Paraguaya el cual utilizarán para la compra de los ingredientes para las comidas que elaboran. Se encuentran muy esperanzadas en este crédito, ya que seria de gran ayuda para ellas.
texts.en:
The Kaaguy Poty Women's Committee was set up thanks to Dali who got in touch with Fundación Paraguaya.  Dali is a rural technician who works in the area and she was the one who told her friends about the possibility of receiving a loan through the "Women's Committee' program.

This committee is made up of ten hard-working and tenacious women.  Their business is making food such as snacks, 'chipas' (cheese buns), sandwiches, etc.  Every day they make and sell the food that they prepare.

These ladies tell us that this is the first time they have requested a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and they will use the money to buy ingredients for the food that they make.  They are very hopeful about this loan since it will be very helpful to them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food such as meat, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with ten children and only three of her children go to school. Rose also takes care of additional family members (a niece and nephew).  She own a mini bakery and makes chapattis, samosas, pancakes and donuts. 

Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 from Kiva partner MCDDT SACCO which she will use to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, baking flour and cow peas. She has been in this business for sixteen years and she works six days week. Rose sells her produce door to door, by means of retail. Her business challenges include ever increasing prices of commodities and the rainy season. Rose decided to join MCDT SACCO to get additional capital for her business. Rose lives in a two room rented house.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, baking flour and cow peas.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad,  es  conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos.  Tiene estudios hasta el 3ro de secundaria.
Con su préstamo anterior de   S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, compró  animales  vacuno y ovino.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas al paso, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un triciclo, utensilios de cocina y víveres para la preparación de sus alimentos.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener una casa en Ilave y viajar a otras ciudades.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las charlas que imparte la Promotora.
texts.en:
Apolinaria is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Concepción," located in the population center of Ayruma Carumas of the Acora district in the province of Puno and department of Puno. She is 35 years old, lives in a committed relationship and has four children. She has studied through the third year of middle school. 

With her previous loan of S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, she bought cattle and sheep. Currently she sells fast food to pedestrians and has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one cycle now. With this new loan of S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles she will purchase a tricycle, kitchen utensils and supplies for making her foods. Her husband and children help her in the business. 

Her dream is to have a house in Ilave and travel to other cities. 

What she likes about the communal bank are its trainings and the talks given by the Facilitator.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle, kitchen utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo de 57 años, reside en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Magda, su esposa desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con la menor, Xiomara, a la que cuidan en su casa propia. La vida de este apacible hombre se centra en la enseñanza a adolescentes del colegio estatal de su localidad, donde lleva trabajando como profesor desde hace 30 años. En todo este tiempo, su trabajo y esfuerzo le ayudaron a comprarse 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde siembra café, obteniendo así una ganancia extra. Cada año, que es el tiempo de cosecha, entrega el grano de café maduro a la cooperativa de la localidad, donde le pagan por el kilo de café. Asimismo está feliz de tener el apoyo de su esposa, quien hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores; donde también surte con la venta de útiles de escritorio y algunos artículos de acuerdo a cada temporada. Ahora desea mejorar su tienda, convirtiéndola en un lugar donde se pueda encontrar “de todo”. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Edgardo de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos para surtir su tienda de comestibles y radios pequeñas que sale mucho en está campaña de cosecha de café, ya que los peones compran para poder escuchar música mientras trabajan.
texts.en:
Edgardo, 57, resides in the community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle). There he formed his family along with Magda, his wife of 22 years. Together they have four children, but they only live with the youngest, Xiomara, whom they care for in their own home. The life of this peaceable man focuses on the teaching of adolescents in the state-run high school of his area, where he has taught as a professor for thirty years. During this time his work and efforts allowed him to buy two hectares of agricultural land, where he grows coffee, thus earning extra income. Each year at harvest time he delivers the ripe coffee beans to the co-op in the area, where they pay him by the kilogram for the beans. He is happy also to have the support of his wife, who recently opened a grocery store, selling staples to area residents as well as supplying stationery and seasonal items. Now she wishes to make improvements to her store, turning it into a place where one can find "a bit of everything." 

He belongs to the communal bank "El palomar al éxito" [The Dovecote to Success] and this is his first loan with MFP, where he hopes to get the support he needs to achieve his goals. Edgardo, upon receiving this support, will invest the money obtained to buy products for stocking the store with grocery items and small radios, which are common during this coffee harvesting season since the laborers buy them to be able to listen to music while they work.

loans.use: to purchase products for stocking his store, as well as radios for resale.

loans.name: Serapia

texts.es: Doña Serapia es madre de 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, doña Serapia es muy trabajadora ya que ha sacado a sus hijos adelante gracias a los negocios que tiene, todas las mañamas se levanta muy temprano para atender el molino de nixtamal, ademas al medio dia  vende tortillas y helados de frutas, es por eso que necesita otro credito para poder seguir ampliando sus negocios el credito en si lo nececita para coprar maiz y leña y asi aumentar sus ganancias ella estaria muy agradeceria si se le llegara a otorgar otro credito ya que en el credito anterios fue muy puntual en los pagos, ademas un credito mas le ayudaria a seguir pagando el estudio de sus hijos que estan en la universidad ya que con otro credito pondria una mini tienda de consumo diario en donde tiene su molino y asi obtendria mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Serapia has three children, and they are all grown.  Serapia is a very hard-worker inasmuch as she has gotten her children ahead thanks to her businesses.  

She gets up very early every morning to attend to the corn mill.  At midday she sells tortillas and fruit ices.

This is why she needs another loan in order to be able to continue expanding her businesses.  She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood.  That way she will increase her earnings.  She would be very grateful if she is granted another loan.  She was very punctual with her payments of previous loans.  

Also, another loan will help her to continue paying for the education of her children who are in the university.  With another loan she will set up a mini store that sells daily consumption products.  She will do this where she has her mill.  That way she will get more income.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her tortilla sales.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She owns a canteen near the school selling all types of snacks like chapattis, samosas, pancakes, biscuits and popcorn. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of wheat flour, cooking oil and baking flour. 

Gorret has been in this business for seven years and works six days a week.  Her business challenge includes ever increasing prices of commodities and the rainy season because she works in a muddy place. She aspires to see her business grow big and employ three girls. She lives in a two room rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of  wheat flour, biscuits, popcorn and cooking oil.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
La Sra. Emilce tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera con tres hijos, Richar de 8, Daniel de 6, y Willian de 3 años, vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
La Sra. Emilce es comerciante hace 10 años, es macatera, es decir vendedora ambulante de artículos en general, como artículos de librería, maquillajes, cosméticos, bijouterí, naipes y demás, las ventas las realiza en las zonas aledañas a su barrio.
Comenzó con unas pequeñas cajas de algunos productos, y de apoco fue creciendo con mucho esfuerzo,comenta que se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para cuidar sus hijos, dejar todo en orden su casa para que ella pueda salir a realizar sus ventas, el cual es el sustento del hogar. Este negocio le ayudo a criar y a educar a  sus hijos.
Para ella la familia es muy importante ya que es madre soltera, sus hijos son la razón de su lucha día a día.
Solicita el credito para poder abastecerse de nuevas mercancías como cosméticos y artículos similares. Ella manifiesta que el credito le sera de mucha utilidad, ya que le permitirá seguir sustentando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilce is 26 years old. She is a single mother with three children: Richar, 8, Daniel, 6, and Willian, 3. She lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo. Mrs. Emilce has been a merchant for ten years. She is a street vendor, that is, she sells general items in the street, such as stationery items, makeup, cosmetics, costume jewelry, playing cards and other items. She sells her wares in the areas surrounding her neighborhood. 

She began with some small boxes of certain products, and from there grew bit by bit, with much effort. She comments that she gets up very early in the morning in order to care for her children and set everything straight in her home, so that she can go out and do her selling, which is how she supports her household. This business helped her raise and school her children. 

For her the family is very important since she is a single mother. Her children are her reason for working day by day. 

She is seeking the loan in order to be able to stock new merchandise such as cosmetics and similar items. She asserts that the loan will be of great use to her, since it will allow her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for stocking her product line.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace catorce años.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cuatro chanchos para su engorde, luego los venderá en la ciudad de Yunguyo
Su sueño es tener más chanchos y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a member of the “San Juan de Tahuaco” Communal Bank, located in the district of Yunguyo, Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Anastacia never went to school.

She and her husband buy and sell household animals. Anastacia's first loan was for the sum of 300 new sols, and was invested in her animal sales business. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 14 years.

Anastacia is requesting a new loan for the sum of 500 new sols, to be used to buy 4 pigs to fatten and sell later in the city of Yunguyo.

Her dream is to have more pigs to improve her earnings.

What she likes best about the Communal Bank are the meetings.

loans.use: buy four pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has eight children, five of whom are in school.  

Hadjah has a business selling sweet bananas.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail.    

Hadjah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet bananas to sell.  The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and ever increasing prices of sweet bananas in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business growing big so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van.   Hadjah lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medications.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Unidas se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní. Este comite se encuentra en el primer ciclo, el mismo cuenta con diez integrantes, todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, son mujeres jefas de familia, que cada día se esfuerzan al máximo para darle a sus hijos una vida decorosa y digna.
Doña Gricelda, es una señora muy trabajadora que se encarga de la cría de animales, posee un grupo reducido de ellos y sueña con algún día tener una granja con muchos animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas crías de animales, ademas de los alimentos que estos consumirán. tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que le sera de gran ayuda frente a los proyectos que ella pretende emprender.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas' (United) committee was formed when several neighbors from the same community, in the city of Santaní, joined together as a group.  This committee is in its first loan cycle with ten [female] members who are all very hard-working and tenacious.  They are heads of their respective families and every day they work as hard as they can to provide their children with a decent and respectable life.

Gricelda is a very hard-working lady who raises animals.  She owns a reduced group of animals and she dreams of some day owning a farm with a lot of animals.

Gricelda is requesting this loan to buy more animals to raise as well as feed for them.  She has her hopes placed in this loan as it will be a great help for the projects that she plans to undertake.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise as well as balanced feed for them

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  is a single mother of five and only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been doing the same business for seven years. 

Besides this clothing business, she also rears and sells chickens at home. Justine sells to all categories of people, retail. Her business challenges include transportation and ever increasing price of clothes.
