For this reason, she needs a loan of ₡100 000 (a hundred thousand colones) to buy the ceramics she needs for her house.  She is very happy because at last she will fix her little house.  

She is a member of the Ostional Cooperative Bank, one of the 110 social credit enterprises of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: buy ceramic floor tiles.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is a 35-year-old, single man from Ramallah. In 2007, Issa opened his own coffee and "Bilardo" shop. He hopes that using this loan he will be able to change the décor of the business premises, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to change the decor of his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  ladies' bags and travelling bags for her business inventory.

loans.name: Carlos Roman

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos, vive  en su domicilio con su esposa y su  pequeña hija,  como el trabaja todo el día  y su esposa se queda al cuidado de su hija  nos  comenta que en varias ocasiones se ha resbalado cuando juega en el frente de su domicilio, ya que  actualmente tiene piso de concreto y tiene portón al frente  para que la niña no salga a la calle, el Sr. Carlos quiere instalar vitropiso en el  frente de su  domicilio , porque  decea  dar una imagen limpia y agradable  , además  de  tener  la  oportunidad  de brindar  una mejor  estancia  a  sus   familiares  y  amigos  que   la visitan  los   fines  de  semana, agradece  de  antemano  el  apoyo  brindado   para la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Carlos lives in his home with his wife and small daughter; he works all day and his wife stays home with their daughter.  He comments to us that, on various occasions, he has slipped when he plays in front of his house.  He currently has a concrete floor and a gated door at the front so his daughter won’t go out into the street.  Carlos wants to install a tile floor at the front of his house because he wants to give a clean an agreeable image.  In addition, it gives him the opportunity to provide a better stay for relatives and friends who visit on the weekends.  He gives thanks ahead of time for the support provided to make his project a reality.

loans.use: install a tile floor at his house.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar de 50 años, reside en el caserío de Antabamba; ahí formó su familia junto a Gregoria, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos menores con quienes vive en su casa propia. Todas las mañanas como es de costumbre, se levanta muy temprano para salir a cuidar de sus terrenos de cultivo que desde hace 20 años viene sembrando con mucha dedicación. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa y arveja que cada temporada esparce entre sus propios terrenos agrícolas brindándole buenas ganancias en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. En todo este tiempo de arduo trabajo logró obtener 25 vacas de las cuales elabora con la leche que produce un promedio de 40 a 30 quesos semanales, ofreciéndoles en la empresa de productos lácteos “La tarmeñita”, donde aparte de ofrecerle un buen precio por la compra, también lo capacitan para el mejoramiento continuo de la calidad de leche. Él se encuentra satisfecho por los logros que esta obteniendo y según menciona desea ahorrar el dinero necesario para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que son jóvenes y estudian carreras universitarias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Oscar, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de vacas lecheras de raza, que le proporcionen mayor cantidad de leche, según comenta cuesta un promedio de mil soles cada una.
texts.en:
50 year-old Oscar lives in the small village of Antabamba.  There he formed his family together with Gregoria, his wife of 20 years.  They have four dependent children with whom they live in their own home.  Every morning, Oscar gets up very early to go out and care for his farmland which he has been sowing for 20 years with a lot of commitment.  His main crops are potatoes and peas that he grows on his own land.  This makes him good profits in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  In parallel with this activity, he also raises cattle.  Over all these years of hard work, he has managed to obtain 25 cows whose milk he uses to make an average of 30 to 40 cheeses a week which he sells to the dairy company “La Tarmeñita”.  In addition to offering him a good price for his products, they also train him in how to continually improve the quality of his milk.

Oscar is happy with his achievements and he says that he would like to save the money he needs to be able to provide a better quality of life for his children who are young and studying university degrees.  He belongs to the "Los Pinos de Antabamba" community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your support in helping him achieve his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his repayments on time as he has done with previous loans that he has received.  Oscar, with your support, will invest the money he has requested in buying a good breed of dairy cow which will provide him with more milk.  He says that they cost, on average, 1,000 Peruvian soles each.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have work done on her roof

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es   conviviente y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar.  Estudió solo hasta 4to de primaria.
Junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, huevos, etc.,  su préstamo anterior de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio.  Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez cajas de galletas de toda marca, veinte paquetes de gaseosas, una caja de huevo y chocolates diversos.  
Su sueño es mejorar su tienda y así mejorar también sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the “Virgen de Concepción” community bank which is located in Ayrumas Carumas, in Acora district, in Puno province and department.  She is 49 years old, lives with her partner, and has three school age children.  She only studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Together with her husband, Agripina sells candies, soda, cookies, eggs, etc.  Her previous loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested it in her business.  She has been a member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.

With this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy ten boxes of cookies of different brands, twenty packets of soda, a crate of eggs and a range of chocolates.

Agripina's dream is to improve her store and thereby also improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining the loans and also the savings.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of cookies of different brands, twenty packets of soda and candies

loans.name: Jorge  Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Alberto  es una persona muy  responsable  y trabajadora  que actualmente labora en una empresa  como chofer de autobús,  su   mayor  sueño  es  acondicionar  su   domicilio  ya  que  con esfuerzos y  dedicación    poco  a  poco  han ido  pagándola , en esta  ocasión requieren de nuestra  ayuda  para  terminar  de  instalar  el  techo  de  su  vivienda  ya  que   viene la  temporada  de lluvias,  agradece  el apoyo  para la  realización de este  proyecto  que  les  permitirá   brindar   una mejor  imagen a  su domicilio  y  asi  mismo  tener   mayor  comodidad.
texts.en: Señor Alberto is a very responsible and hard-working person who currently works for a company as a bus driver.  His biggest dream is to make improvements to his home.  Through his effort and dedication, he has paid for this little by little.  This time, he needs our help to finish putting a roof on his house since the rainy season is coming.  He is thankful for the support to carry out this project, which will let him make his house look better and also be more comfortable.

loans.use: To put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 47 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Sanchirio (selva central peruana), ahí vivió junto a sus 5 hijos a los que crió y educó sólo. Ahora él, vive en su casa propia. Gracias a su trabajo como “agricultor”, brindó a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que puedan salir adelante. Desde niño le enseñaron todo lo necesario para poder emprender por si solo en sus propios sembríos. Es así que tiene  20 años sembrando  café y plátanos sobre sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que gracias a su esfuerzo logró conseguir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las épocas de cosecha, ya que puede ver concretizado su esfuerzo. Y según cuenta le va muy bien en las ventas, donde obtiene buenas ganancias cada vez que vende el café en la cooperativa y en sus viajes cada 20 días a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende los plátanos maduros. Pero en sus tiempo libres se dedica al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas de la ciudad de Santa Ana hacia su localidad, donde obtiene ganancias extras. Ahora desea ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos, y para lograrlo está pensando cortar algunos árboles; venderlos a una cajonería y así tener mayor espacio para sembrar más. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Alejandro, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos. Asimismo en la compra de una motosierra para comenzar el proceso de ampliación de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 47, lives in the native community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle). He used to live there with his 5 children, whom he raised and educated on his own. Now he lives in his own house. Thanks to his work as a farmer he was able to give his children the education they needed to get ahead. From an early age he learnt everything he required to initiate his own farming business. He has now been farming coffee and bananas for 20 years in the 4 hectares of land he has managed to obtain thanks to his hard work . 

What he enjoys the most about his job is harvest time, because it shows his hard work. And he explains that sales are going well, and that he obtains good profits when he sells coffee to the cooperative and when he goes to the city of Huancayo every 20 days to sell ripe bananas. In his spare time he works in public transport and covers the routes from the city of Santa Ana to his town, which provides him with extra income. 

He would like to expand his crop lands and he is thinking of cutting down some trees, selling them to a joiner and obtaining some extra space. He is a member of the "El Palomar al Exito" ("The Dovecot to Success") communal bank and this is his fourth loan with MFP. He's hoping to obtain a small loan to meet his goals. He is also once more committed to repaying it as agreed, just like with previous loans. He enjoys being part of his communal bank because all members are responsible and supportive individuals. If he obtains the loan, Alejandro will invest the money received in the purchase of several bags of compost that he will spread among his crops, as well as in the purchase of a chainsaw to begin the process of expanding his crop land.

loans.use: to buy several bags of compost and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 45 años, reside en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana) en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Judith y Luis a los que cuida con mucho amor en una casa alquilada. A pesar de tener muchos inconvenientes en su vida y de luchar con ahínco para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Alejandro se siente feliz de dedicar su vida a la agricultura, principal actividad económica de su familia. Desde hace 8 años trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos de café y plátanos; donde le pagan un promedio de S/. 600 nuevos soles semanales por cultivar, machetear y mantener limpio los sembríos. “No pude obtener mis propios terrenos ya que tenía que invertir todas mis ganancias en mantener a mis hijos”, menciona con mucha nostalgia y a la vez con orgullo. Además de compartir su tiempo en el negocio de compra y venta de frutas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo (sierra del Perú), donde viaja una vez al mes, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ahora su objetivo principal es poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este será su segundo crédito con MFP, donde está contento de saber que obtendrá el apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Alejandro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la construcción de su propia casa y si el dinero le alcanza lo invertirá para su negocio de frutas.
texts.en: Alejandro is 45 and lives in the town of Alto Yapaz (in the central Peruvian jungle) with his two children, Judith and Luis, for whom he cares with a lot of love.  They live in a rented house.  In spite of having a lot of inconveniences in his life and working diligently to take good care of his children, Alejandro is very happy dedicating his life to agriculture, which is his family’s main source of economic income.  He has worked for 8 years as a laborer on various coffee and plantain farms.  They pay him an average of 600 PEN a week to plant, cut, and weed these fields.  “I couldn’t get my own land because I had to invest all of my profits into taking care of my children,” he mentioned with a lot of nostalgia and also pride.  He also dedicates time to a business of buying and selling fruits in the wholesale market in Huancayo (in the mountains of Peru), where he travels once a month.  He makes good profits with this business.  His main goal is to give his children a good education.  He belongs to the communal bank, “El Palomar al éxito,” and this will be his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He is happy to know that he will obtain financial support to reach his goals.  He promises to make all of his payments on time, like with his previous loans that he has had.  Alejandro will invest the requested money in the construction of his own home, and if he has enough money left, in his fruit business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house and to buy fruit to supply his business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y  tiene dos hijos.  Tiene estudios hasta el cuarto de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace más de un año, su préstamo anterior que fue por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de carnes de cordero y alpaca.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis degollados de cordero.  Lla señora trabaja sola en el negocio y realiza sus ventas en el mercado de Ilave.
Su sueño es tener más capital y tener otro negocio como venta de celulares.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la alegría de las socias y la ganancia de los ahorros.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the communal bank, “San Miguel Arcángel II,” which is located in the district of Llave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno.  She is 34, is a single mother, and has two children.  She completed through the fourth year of secondary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for more than a year.  Her previous loan was for 500 PEN, which she invested in her business of buying and selling lamb and alpaca meat.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy six prepared lambs.  She works alone in her business and makes her sales in the market in Llave.

Her dream is to have more capital and to have another business selling cell phones.  What she likes most about her communal bank is the happiness of the members and saving money.

loans.use: to buy six prepared lambs

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es una persona que se dedica a la venta de platillos caseros, y repostería, los  cuales vende  en las maquiladoras a todos los empleados  y de  esta  manera ella sostiene la casa, su alimentación y todos sus gastos personales,  además apoya a sus hijos que viven en otras ciudades, en este  momento ella  requiere invertir  en  la compra de ropa nueva para vender al publico  y de  esta manera  ayudarse económicamente y  que  mejor  que  realizando  lo  que  mas   le gusta   que   es  dedicarse  a  las  ventas ,  ya  que  ella  siempre  a sentido  cierta  atracción  en  el  ramo, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado por la  institución para  la realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Señora Juana is a person who makes a living by selling homemade food and baked goods, which she sells at factories to all of the employees.  In this way, she supports her home by paying for food and personal expenses.  She also supports her children that live in other cities.  Right now, she needs to invest in the purchase of new clothing to sell to the public to help herself economically and to keep doing what she likes, which is sales.  She has always felt a certain attraction to this trade.  She is thankful for the support offered to her by the institution to carry out her project.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 30 años, reside en la comunidad de Yapaz bajo (selva central peruana). Ahí vive en casa de sus padres a los que cuida y protege como buen hijo. Como joven emprendedor y ambicioso; Alfredo cuenta que desde los 15 años, se dedicó a la agricultura, desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario para poder sacar adelante las 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola que heredó por parte de sus padres, a los que ahora cuida, pues son ancianos y no tienen las mismas fuerzas de antes. Su principal sembrío consta de café y plátanos, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y dedicación. Según cuenta sus platanales le brindan fruto cada 15 días, comercializando a un buen precio a los mismos acopiadores que visitan la zona, aunado al café que cosecha una vez al año, son vendidos en la ciudad de La Merced. Sin embargo en época donde no hay mucha cosecha de café; comparte su tiempo con el oficio de carpintero; donde obtiene una ganancia extra. Ahora su principal objetivo es poder mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y expandir más sus terrenos de cultivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este será su segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Alfredo, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago a los peones que le están ayudando a cosechar el café maduro en está campaña agrícola.
texts.en: Alfredo is 30-years-old and lives in the community of Yapaz Bajo (in the central Peruvian jungle).  He lives in his parents’ home, and he cares for them and protects them like a good son.  Like an enterprising and ambitious young person, Alfredo tells us that he has worked in agriculture since he was 15.  Since then, he has learned everything he needs to be able to take good care of his 5 hectares of land that his parents gave him.  He takes care of them now because they are elderly and they don’t have as much strength as they used to.  His main harvests consist of coffee and plantains, which he cares for with a lot of dedication.  He tells us that he harvests from his plantain trees every two weeks and he sells the fruit at a good price to the wholesalers that visit the area.  He harvests coffee once a year, and that is sold in the city of La Merced.  During seasons when he is not harvesting coffee, he also dedicates some time to working as a carpenter, where he obtains extra income.  His main goal is to improve the quality of her crops and to expand the land that he owns.  He belongs to the communal bank, “El Palomar al exito,” and this will be his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He is very happy to know that he will have the financial support that he needs so much.  He promises to make all of his payments on time, like he has with previous loans that he has had.  Alfredo will invest the money requested in paying the laborers that help him harvest his mature coffee crop.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help him with his coffee harvest

loans.name: Tututepec San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tututepec San Pedro sus integrantes le pusieron  así por que  es el nombre de su pueblo. El grupo  Tututepec San Pedro esta conformado  por  doce personas, tienen  como representante  de grupo a la señora Alma Eva  que tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Este grupo  esta ubicado  en la localidad San Pedro estado de Oaxaca.
La señora Claudia  tiene 39 años  estudio hasta  quinto grado de la primaria , tiene  tres hijos  dos mujeres y un varón. La señora Claudia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y a la venta de pollo. La señora Claudia necesitaba el préstamo para  para comprar mas pollos , ya que la ganancia la va utilizar para hacer una pollerilla. 
El negocio  de los pollos lo empezó desde hace tres años atrás antes de que pusiera su tienda de abarrotes.
Sus clientes  la prefieren por que les  vende muy bien , otra de las cosas es por que les da fiado y  cuando cobran le van a pagar, es una forma de ayudar a sus  clientes.
La señora Claudia   lo que desea de este préstamo  es de hacerse  de una pollería  mas grande , para tener mas ganancias y así ayudar a sus hijos ,para que puedan terminar sus estudios, también para tener una mejor calidad de vida .
Los  otros  diez integrantes se llaman:
Cristina – para la compra de hilos para hacer manteles , servilletas.
Enma  Margarita – para la venta de zapatos.
Alejandra –compra de maíz para , poder vender tortillas.
Francisca-para la compra de materiales para hacer tamales.
Eva –para  la compra de mercancía para  su tienda de abarrotes.
Ciria- para poderse trasladar y vender  carnes frías.
Rosario-para materiales para hacer tamales.
Berta- para materiales para hacer tamales.
Elia-para la compra y venta de frutas y verduras.
Donaciana- para la  venta y compra de calzado.

Le dan las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que les a brindado.
texts.en:
This group is called Tututepec San Pedro.  The members named it after their village.  The 'Tututepec San Pedro' group has twelve members.  The group's representative is Alma Eva who owns a grocery store.  This group is located in the town of San Pedro, in the State of Oaxaca.

Claudia is 39 years old and studied up to the fifth grade of elementary school.  She has three children: two daughters and one son.  Her business is selling groceries and also selling chicken.  She needs this loan to buy more chickens since she will use the profits to set up a chicken store.

Claudia started her chicken business three years ago, before she set up her grocery store.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she sells very well.  In addition, she sells on credit and when her customers get paid, they pay her.  It is a way of helping her customers.

What Claudia would like to gain from this loan is a large chicken store so that she can make more profits and thereby help her children to finish their studies.  She would also like to be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

The other ten members of this group are:

Cristina – who will buy threads for making tablecloths and napkins
Enma Margarita – who will sell shoes
Alejandra – who will buy corn so that she can sell tortillas
Francisca – who will buy supplies for making tamales
Eva – who will buy merchandise for her grocery store
Ciria – who will transport and sell cold meats
Rosario – who will buy supplies for making tamales
Berta – who will buy materials for making tamales
Elia – who will buy and sell fruit and vegetables
Donaciana – who will buy and sell footwear

The women are grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given them.

loans.use: to buy and sell chicken

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en Centro Poblado Sanquera, distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos.  Solo estudió la primaria.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como ovejas y chanchos.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de ovejas.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años.
Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez unidades de ovejas (las compra y vende al instante, a veces las engorda por dos meses antes de su venta).  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, quien es albañil (operario de construcción).
Su sueño es mejorar con los ganados y así tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the "San Juan de Tahuaco" community bank which is located in the village of Sanquera, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department.  She is 34 years old, married, and has three children.  She only has an elementary school level of education.

Adela's business is buying and selling animals such as sheep and pigs.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to buy sheep.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.

Adela will use this new loan for 2,000 soles to buy ten head of sheep (she buys and sells them right away but sometimes she fattens them for two months before she sells them).  Her children and her husband help her in this business.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Adela's dream is to improve her livestock business and thereby make more profits.

What Adela enjoys about her community bank are the meetings and the training talks.

loans.use: to buy ten head of sheep

loans.name: Maritza Mirtha

texts.es: La señora Maritza tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad que esta en el colegio, maritza se dedica a vender productos de belleza de distintos catalagos, los desafíos que enfrenta maritza es trabajar para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo ya que ella es madre solera y no tiene el apoyo de su pareja, el dinero que esta solicitando es para mejoramiento de vivienda, ponerle piso a su sala y comprar algunos materiales como cemento arenilla entre otros, maritza tiene mucho sueños uno de ellos es hacer crecer mas su negocio, y poco a poco seguir arreglando su vivienda, maritza esta muy agradecida por la confianza que se esta brindando.
texts.en:
Maritza is 34 years old.  She is a single mother and she has a 12 year-old son who is in school.  Maritza's business is selling beauty products from different catalogs.  The challenge that she faces is working to provide a better quality of life for her son as she is a single mother and doesn't have any support from her partner.

Maritza is requesting this money to improve her home, lay flooring in her living room and buy some materials such as cement and [fine] sand.

Maritza has many dreams.  One of these dreams is to further grow her business and gradually continue fixing up her home.  Maritza is very grateful for the trust is being placed in her.

loans.use: to improve her home, lay flooring in her living room and buy cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Sumeldita

texts.es: Sumeldita de 28 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa  junto a su pareja Ezequiel de 35 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Renzo de 06 años y Ever de 01 año de edad por quienes se esmera en trabajar muy duro. Ella cuenta, que se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia y luego alista a su mayor hijo para mandarle a su colegio, para así dirigirse tranquilamente a la chacra con su amado esposo. Sumeldita cultiva plantas de cacao, café, y variedad de frutas cítricas, productos importantes que le sirven de sustento para sobre salir y cubrir el gasto de educación. En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Gracias a las sugerencias de las socias de su banco ella optó en acercarse a MFP para solicitar su crédito ya que ella tiene referencias que nuestra institución presta créditos a las personas mas necesitadas con fines a invertir el dinero en algo útil. Con el apoyo de los financistas llevará acabo sus actividades programadas, por ello requiere el dinero para comprar sacos de abono para mejorar sus tierras  y volverlas muy fructíferas. Posteriormente piensa comprar más espacios de terreno para seguir cultivando. Este será su primer crédito, por ello espera de la colaboración para poder comprar los productos sugeridos, a la vez se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono ya que le servirán para mejorar sus plantas.
texts.en:
28 year-old Sumeldita is a very unassuming and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 35 year-old Ezequiel, and her two beloved children: 6 year-old Renzo and 1 year-old Ever, for whom she works very hard.

Sumeldita tells us that she gets up very early in the morning to prepare food for the members of her family.  She then gets her eldest son ready for school and heads peacefully to the farm together with her husband who she loves very much.  Sumeldita grows cacao and coffee plants and a variety of citrus fruits.  These are important products which help support her family and cover her children's education expenses.  During harvest and weeding times, she must hire day laborers so that she can advance more quickly in her work.  Thanks to suggestions from the members of her community bank, she decided to come to MFP to request a loan since she was told that our institution provides loans to those who are most in need and who plan to invest their money in something useful.

With the support of lenders, Sumeldita will carry out her planned farming activities.  She needs money to buy sacks of manure so that she can improve her land and make it more productive.  She later plans to buy more land so that she can continue growing her crops.  This will be Sumeldita's first loan and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can buy the products she needs.  Sumeldita pledges to make her loan repayments on time as she would like to access other loans in the future.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy sacks of manure which will help her to improve her plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario es una persona, que junto con su distinguida esposa atienden su negocio el cual ya  tiene ocho  años operando,  en esta  ocasión  ellos   requieren de  nuestra  ayuda  porque  desean  invertir  en su local  y  obtener  la posibilidad  de  brindar  una  mayor  variedad  de  productos  a sus  clientes asi  como un excelente  servicio  y  esto  les permitirá  obtener  mayores ingresos  para  seguir ofreciendo a  su   familia  una  excelente  calidad   de   vida.
texts.en: Together with his distinguished wife, Mario works in his business which he has been running for eight years.  On this occasion, he and his wife need our help because they would like to invest in their store and have the possibility of providing their customers with a greater variety of products, as well as excellent service.  This will allow them to make more income so that they can continue offering their family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 57 años, madre de cinco hijos los cuales son mujeres y hombres de bien según comento. Ella se dedica desde hace varios años al comercio de frutas, verduras y granos básicos entre otros. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en frutas y verduras de temporada para fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en: María del Carmen is 57 years old.  She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has five children.  She tells us that all of her children are fine, upstanding men and women.   María has been selling fruit, vegetables, basic grains and other products for several years.  She will invest this loan in buying seasonal fruit and vegetables in order to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila de 47 años de edad, convive con su pareja Marcial y fruto de ello concibieron 03 hijos las cuales vienen cursando la etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Antonio, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Teofila, menciona que todo lo que va obteniendo es a base de tenacidad y entrega a sus cultivos de cacao, café y plátanos, es por ello que trata de dar el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones y bajo esa propuesta es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos por la calidad de sus productos. Por ello trata de esmerarse en dedicarle más tiempo a sus productos, conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, pero en tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los peones, para que de esa manera pueda avanzar con rapidez en las extracciones de los frutos. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios como la crianza de cuyes. Este será su cuarto crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez mas con el apoyo de ustedes y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia muy cooperadora. Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá plantas de café, para ampliar sus cultivos y así obtener mayores ingresos a medida que las plantas broten sus frutos.
texts.en:
Teofila, age 47, lives with her life partner, Marcial, and their three children.  The children go to school.  They live in San Antonio, which is in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, where they have their own house.

Teofila says that everything they have been getting stems from tenacity and the dedication to her cacao, coffee, and banana crops.  That is why she tries to give her crops the best care.  By doing this a lot of her buyers have been pleased with the quality of her products.  She therefore tries, together with help from her life partner, to take great care in devoting more time with her crops.  However, during harvesting times she needs the help of field workers.  This way she is able to gather the crop production more quickly.  

Her plan for the future is to invest her earnings in a different type of business like raising guinea pigs.

This will be her fourth loan.  She is very happy to know that she can once again count on your support.  She is prepared to make her payments punctually.  She is a very helpful member of her communal bank.  She will use the money from the loan to buy coffee plants.  She will do this in order to increase her crops and to get greater income when the plants are mature.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Dina Brigida

texts.es:
Dina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, es   conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria. 
Viene  trabajando con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de granos de la Región, engorde de ganados vacunos, también dice que vende comidas rápidas y frutas. Es toda una empresaria.
Con este nuevo préstamo  de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles dinero, comprará un toro y también comprará frutas como manzana, plátano, naranjas y peras para su trueque (canje de uno por otro producto).  La señora nos cuenta que también se dedica  a la artesanía, a la fabricación de chalinas, chompas, mantones, manoplas, guantes y títeres.  Ella cuenta con el apoyo y ayuda de su esposo, quien a veces trabaja en la  ciudad de Arequipa.
Su sueño es ser empresaria de artesanías en general y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas respecto a la convivencia familiar y el manejo del dinero.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Virgen de Concepción Bank in the Ayrumas Carumas village, Acora district, Puno province and department.  She is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She went to school up to the third year of high school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  She used her first loan of 500 soles to invest in her business of selling regional grains and fattening cows.  She says that she also sells fast food and fruit.  She is totally a businesswoman.

She will use this new loan for 2,000 soles to buy a bull.  She will also buy fruits like apples, bananas, oranges, and pears for her exchange (swapping one product for another).

She tells us that she also makes handicrafts.  She makes scarves, sweaters, shawls, mittens, gloves, and puppets.  She has her husband’s help and support.  At times he works in the city of Arequipa.

Her dream is to be a general handicrafts businesswoman.  That would improve her income.  The talks about family life and managing money are what she likes about her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy a bull and to also buy fruit.

loans.name: Sabrina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sabrina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ruth Iliana de 31 años quien tiene un kiosco el cual inicio con la venta de comida mexicana. Ella en la actualidad vende  gaseosa, chiverías y cigarro, además vende perfumes y cremas. 
El crédito invertirá en la compra de productos en cosméticos, perfume, cremas…etc. los cuales tiene muchos encargos.

Las otras integrantes de son Elena María propietaria de una pulpería y vende ropa, y Estela del Socorro  propietaria de un modesto comedor desde hace 17 años y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Sabrina group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.

Ruth Iliana, age 31, is one of them.  She has a kiosk, which she started by selling Mexican food.  Now she sells soft drinks, snacks, and cigars.  She also sells perfumes and creams.

She will use the loan to buy cosmetic products like perfume and cream, etc.  She has a lot of orders for them.

Another member is Elena María.  She has a grocery store and sells clothes.  The other member is Estela del Socorro.  She has had a modest eatery for 17 years, and she sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 48 años de edad, madre de 04 hijos por quienes vela a diario y en futuro promisorio hacer de ellos hombres de bien. Ella esta casada con Faustino de 49 años y cuentan con casa propia situada en el distrito de Quimbiri. Maximiliana desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a ganarse la vida y a comprarse sus propias prendas de vestir y pagar sus estudios con el esfuerzo de si misma. Ella tuvo una infancia muy dura de la cual tuvo que salir a base de trabajo y perseverancia. A sus 17 años se independizó y dejó de ser empleada y abrió su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, que inicialmente lo hacía dentro de la casa de sus padres y con el transcurso del tiempo compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa la bodega de la señora Maximiliana. Ella es una mujer de armas tomar y señala que uno logra su propósito a base de perseverancia. Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, es mas ella tiene casi todo los productos que sus clientes requieren, además que ofrece una buena atención a sus clientes y hace que la bodega de Maximiliana sea tan concurrida pues no hay cliente que no desearía  ir a comprarle una migaja de sus productos. Ella necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando buen servicio a sus consumidores. Necesita comprar balanza, mostradores, y mesas para exhibir su mercadería y sabe que lo logrará gracias al apoyo de los financistas. Este será su tercer  crédito de Maximiliana y esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo que necesita para su negocio. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará, balanza, mostradores y mesas.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, age 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  She has four sons whom she watches over daily.  They have a bright future, and will see to it that they become honorable men. She is married to Faustino, age 49.  They have their own house in the Quimbiri district.

Ever since she was a young girl her parents taught her to earn a living, to buy her owns clothes, and to pay for her education through her own efforts.  She had a very difficult childhood, and she had to leave due to her work and her perseverence.  She became independent when she was 17.  She stopped being an employee and opened her own business, a grocery store.  In the beginning the business was in her parents’ house.  As time passed she bought a piece of land where Maximiliana’s store is now situated.

She is a capable woman, and she indicates that one achieves their goal through perseverance.  She is now comfortable with her business activity and with the income that she gets.  She has almost all of the products that her customers need.  Also, she provides good customer service.  This makes Maximiliana’s store very popular.  There is not a customer who does not wish to go shopping to buy some of her products.

She needs the loan to continue prospering and providing good service to her consumers.  She needs to buy a scale, counters, and tables to display her merchandise.  She knows that she will do it thanks to the support of the lenders.  This will be Maximiliana’s third loan.  She is very happy to know that she will get financial support because, with that support, she feels certain that she will buy what she needs for her business.  She will use the 2,000 soles to buy a scale, counters, and tables.

loans.use: to buy a scale, counters, and tables for her store.

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Originales lo conforman por tres mujeres trabajadoras y  emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Juana de 51 años quien se dedica al comercio de calzado. Ella inicio su negocio hace ocho años vendiendo por encargo actualmente tiene un taller y vende por docena.

Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Darling  quien desde hace más de tres años vende cosméticos Avon, marca de gran prestigio en Nicaragua y ropa  y Sonia  vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en:
The Originales group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.  Juana, age 51, is the coordinator.  She sells footwear.  She started her business eight years ago; she sold by orders.  She currently has a shop, and she sells by the dozen.

Darling is another member of the group.  She has been selling Avon cosmetics, a very prestigious brand in Nicaragua, and clothes for over three years.  The other member of the group, Sonia, sells tortillas and cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy materials like leather, thread, and insoles, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está formado por 8 mujeres amables, carismáticas, luchadoras y muy trabajadoras. Viven por la comunidad de Zhidmad, este lugar esta  rodeado de naturaleza y vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades. Nuestras socias realizan los créditos para mejorar su situación económica, invierten en sus negocios y así pueden sacar adelante a sus familias.

La Señora. Zoila es una de las socias de este Banco Comunal, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad.

Tiene 40 años,  está  separada de su esposo pero de  su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 20, 17, 16 y 7 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuela de la comunidad. La casa en la que habita es propia.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a la cría de ganado, cuyes y cerdos, a los que los vende en su propia comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura y los productos que obtiene  son para su consumo y el sobrante lo vende.

Se encuentra hace 9 años en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es terminar su casa y  tener más animales.

Las 2 fotos pequeñas adjuntas es de 2 socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes en la reunión cuando fué tomada la fotografía.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanacer” (New Dawn) Communal Bank is comprised of eight kind, charismatic, tenacious, and very hard-working women.  They live in the Zhidmad community.  This place is surrounded by nature and vegetation.  Its people dedicate themselves to raising animals, agriculture, and some work in different business activities in the city of Cuenca.  Our members use the loans to improve their financial situations.  They invest in their businesses, and that way they are able to get their families ahead.

Zoila is one of the members of this communal bank, and she lives in the Zhidmad community.  She is 40 years old, and she is separated from her husband.  They have four children; ages 20, 17, 16, and 7.  The first three are in high school, and the last child attends a community school.  The house they live in is their own. 

 Zoila raises cattle, guinea pigs, and pigs.  She sells them in her own community.  She also farms, and the products she gets are for her family’s consumption.  She sells the extra.

She has been in the communal bank for nine years.  She will use her new loan to buy feed for her animals.  Her goal is to finish her house and to have more animals. 

The two tiny photos are of two members who, due to work commitments, could not be present in the meeting when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 26 años de edad, convive con Víctor  de 30 años y fruto de su relación concibieron dos hijos, Mayra de 05 años y Abel de 02 años de edad y juntos residen en su propia casa en el distrito de Quimbiri. Dina es  una mujer muy luchadora con ganas de sobre salir  y triunfar en la vida,  su actividad  rutinaria es apoyar a su pareja en la elaboración de ladrillos de construcción. En el trabajo de la ladrillerilla viene trabajando 07años y su almacén central se encuentra en el populoso distrito de Quimbiri. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de 03 trabajadores quienes se encargan del proceso y reparto a domicilios. Existe mucha demanda en su negocio, porque atiende pedidos y abastece a diferentes distritos de la zona del Valle Río Apurímac como son: Pichari, San Francisco y Santa Rosa localidades prosperas y con mayor crecimiento económico. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales como desmonte de tierras y hornos para la elaboración de sus ladrillos. En lo futuro tiene proyectado comprar su propia movilidad un carro de carga para poder trasladar su mercadería y así reducir los gastos en el alquiler del transporte. Este será su sexto crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá otro apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo y  esta muy contenta  trabajar de la mano de las socias de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado le servirá como capital para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus ladrillos.
texts.en:
Dina, age 26, lives with 30 year old Víctor, and they have two children.  Mayra is 5, and Abel is 2.  They live in their own house in the Quimbiri district.  Dina is a very tenacious woman with the desire to get ahead and succeed in life.  Her daily routine is to help her husband make bricks for construction.  He has worked in the brick making-industry for seven years.  

Their central warehouse is in the populous district of Quimiri.  He has three helpers who take charge of delivering to homes.  There is much demand in his business because they take care of orders and stock different districts like Pichari, San Francisco and Santa Rosa, in the Vallé Río zone.  These are prosperous locations with great economic growth.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials to clear the land and ovens to make their bricks.  In the future she plans to buy her own car for hauling the bricks in order to be able to transport her merchandise and reduce the expense of renting transportation.

This will be her sixth loan.  She is very happy to know that she will have another loan.  That way she is sure to advance with her work.  She is very happy to work hand in hand with the members of her communal bank.  She will use the requested loan to buy raw materials to make their bricks.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra María  actualmente  tiene  un  transporte  escolar  el  cual le permite  obtener  ingresos  para  sacar  adelante  a  su  familia, en esta  ocasión   necesita  de  nuestra  ayuda  para  realizar la compra  de herramientas para su transporte ya  que  le  surgieron  algunas   fallas  y   teme  en  que  estas   pudieran ocasionar     mayores  complicaciones    las   cuales originaran la  suspensión  del servicio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
María currently has a vehicle used for school transportation.  It allows her to get income in order to get her family ahead.  

She now needs our help in order to buy tools for her vehicle because some defects have arisen.  She fears that these could cause greater complications leading to the suspension of her service.

She is grateful for the support given in order to fulfill her project.

loans.use: to make repairs on school transportation.

loans.name: Cueto Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cueto lo conforman por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Mercedes de 29 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace cuatro años la cual inicio con la venta de chiverias y pequeñas.
Ella tiene un niño de 2 años quien es su motivación y por el cual desea fortalecer su negocio con la comprara de granos básicos, carne, huevo, pan, productos lácteos…etc.

Los otros integrantes son la señora Luz Adilia de 41 años propietaria de un pequeño bar que inicio hace 12 años y Francisco Gutiérrez de 55 años quien tiene un pequeño taller de recarga de baterías.
texts.en:
The Cueto group is comprised of three hard-working, courageous, and enterprising people.  Mercedes, age 29, has had a small grocery store for four years.  She started by selling snacks and such.

She has a two year old son who is her motivation.  It is for him that she wishes to strengthen her business by purchasing basic grains, meat, eggs, bread, and dairy products, etc.

Luz Adilia, age 41, is another member.  She has a small bar, which she started 12 years ago.  The other member is Francisco Gutiérrez, age 55.  He has a small shop for recharging batteries.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, eggs, bread, and dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad,  es divorciada y tiene dos hijos en su haber;  Miguel de 14 y Patricia  de 08 años de edad, viven en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Quimbiri. María trata de luchar contra las  adversidades del destino y  olvidar la inestabilidad familiar que aqueja su hogar,  se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva en el negocio, a pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino. Desde hace 5 años trabaja de forma independiente, ella posee un puesto en donde vende ropa para todo de público en general, en efecto reconoce el beneficio que esta teniendo, ya que sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito radica en la calidad y el precio de su producto. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo y su punto de venta lo realiza en la plaza “La Gamarrita” de su misma localidad. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar y por ello que recurre a los préstamos para seguir surgiendo y abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa alquilar un espacio en la galería comercial para poder vender y así exhibir toda variedad de ropas hacia el publico, según lo gustos y preferencias. Este será su 16avo crédito, espera una vez más ser apoyada con su apoyo para seguir surgiendo. Con el monto solicitado comprará  mayor cantidad de ropa por lo cual tiene que viajar a la ciudad de lima para adquirir  las mercadería a precio módico.
texts.en:
María, age 36, is divorced and has two children under her care.  Miguel is 14, and Patricia is 8.  They live in a rented house in the city of Quimbiri.  María tries to fight against the adversities of destiny.   She also tries to forget the family instability that distresses her household. 

She is known for being a woman of character and for being very competitive in her business.  She does this in spite of having had setbacks along the way.  She has been working in an independent manner for five years.  She has a stall where she sells clothing for all ages.  As a matter of fact, she recognizes the gains she has made because her sales are increasing over time.

The key to her success stems from the quality and the price of her product.  She usually works on her own, but sometimes her son helps her.  She sells in the La Gamarrita plaza in her town.  She is aware the she needs a lot to move up.  That is why she turns to the loans in order to keep developing and to keep stocking her merchandise.

In time, she plans to rent a space in the commercial gallery.  She will do this in order to be able to sell and display all types of clothing according to the taste and preferences of the public.

This will be her 16th loan.  She hopes, one more time, to receive your support in order to continue developing.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of clothes.  To do so, she needs to travel to the city of Lima in order to get the merchandise at a reasonable price.

loans.use: to travel to the capital to stock up on more clothes.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia  es  una persona  trabajadora y  muy responsable  la cual  se  dedica  a  la   venta  de  pasteles  y  repostería ,  de esta  manera  obtiene   sus  ingresos  para   sacar  adelante  a  su  familia, en esta  ocasión requiere de  nuestra  ayuda  para  realizar  la   compra de mercancía para su negocio  ya  que  diariamente  esta  elaborando  sus  productos para   tener  a la venta y  así  tener  la posibilidad  de  brindarles  a sus  clientes los  pasteles  y galletas que en el  momento   le solicitan.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working and very responsible person who sells cakes and confectionery.  This is how she makes income in order to get her family ahead in life.

On this occasion, Claudia needs our help to buy merchandise for her business since she is currently making her products every day in order to have them available to sell.  In this way, she will be able to provide her customers with cakes and cookies when they ask for them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: La Amistad Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Amistad Centro esta formado por 5 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes son amigos y conocidos, viven en los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad  desde diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es muy amable y cordial. Los integrantes de este grupo son personas trabajadoras y luchan día a día para salir adelante con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este Banco Comunal es la Señora Rosa, ella vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Tiene 42 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 23, 18 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja para cubrir sus gastos personales, su segunda hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa tiene hace 7 años un  bazar el mismo que atiende de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una vecina, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
The “La Amistad Centro” (The Friendship Center) Communal Bank is comprised of five women and three men.  They are friends and acquaintances who live in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city was named the Cultural Heritage of Humanity in December, 1999. The city has a widely varied gastronomy, which captivates the palate of natives and foreigners. Its people are warm and friendly. 

The members of this group are hard-working people who struggle day to day in order to get their families ahead.

Rosa is one of the members of the communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  She is 42 years old and married.  She has two children, ages 23 and 18.  Her first child, a son, works to cover his personal expenses.  Her second child, a daughter, attends a school in the city.  Her husband is out of the country.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a rented home.

Rosa has had a bazaar for seven years.  She tends this business from Monday through Friday from nine in the morning until seven at night.

This is her first loan with the communal bank, which she was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will use the money from the loan to buy items for her bazaar.

loans.use: to buy bazaar items.

loans.name: San Jose Las Juquilitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San José las Juquilitas,  sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle así   por que son muy devotos a la virgen de Juquila , este grupo se encuentra en el pueblo de San Miguel del Progreso.
El grupo San José las Juquilitas  cuenta con mas de diez integrantes, también tiene una representante de grupo se llama  Gregoria cuenta con una escolaridad de  nivel medio superior.
Este grupo esta conformado  por  trece integrantes once son mujeres  y dos son hombres .
Uno de sus integrantes la señora  Brenda ,  tiene  treinta siete años  de edad ,cuenta con  la escolaridad la secundaria terminada ,  tiene  tres hijos muy trabajadores e inteligentes , tres mujeres y un varón. La señora  Brenda  se dedica a lo que es la repostería , siempre la a gustado hacer  pasteles. Desde muy chica  vendía pasteles  de  casa en casa , pero con el, paso y conloar ahorros a podido comprarse sus cosas y  hacer sus propios , postres y pasteles en su casa cuenta con muchos clientes .
La razón por la cual pidió su préstamo es para poder rentar un local y poder vender sus pasteles ahí, para  que las personas que vayan al puebla de  san Juan del progreso pruebe sus pasteles y vuelva a visitarla.
Le gustaría   hacer de sus  ganancias una de las mejores  pastelerías de su localidad San José del Progreso ,para  tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para las personas que mas quiere que son su esposo Pablo y sus hijos Brenda , Miriam , Lourdes y Gustavo.
Los otros   doce integrantes del grupo son:
María del Carmen-la venta de zapatos.
Elena –venta de comida.
Catalina-para la venta de comida
Bertha-la compra y venta de ropa.
Teodora-la compra de materiales para  hacer tamales.
Fabiola- para la venta de calzado.
Celia- para la venta de ropa.
Eleazar-compra de material de albañilería.
Manuel-materiales para el campo.
Beatriz-para la compra de pollo.
Brenda-para la venta y compra de calzado.

Todos los que conforman el grupo  José las Ju quilitas le dan las gracias al equipo de trabajo de fundación realidad por el apoyo que les a dado.
texts.en:
This group is called San José las Juquilitas.  The members decided upon this name because they are very devoted to the virgin of Juquila.  The group is located in the town of San Miguel de Progreso.  The San José las Juquilitas group has over ten members.  Gregoria is the group representative.  She has a high school education.

The group is comprised of 13 members, 11 women and 2 men.  Brenda is one of the members.  She is 37 years old, and she has a high school education.  She has three daughters and a son who are very hard-working and intelligent.  Brenda makes pastry.  She has always liked making cakes.  When she was a girl she sold cakes door to door. 

However, with time and savings she was able to buy her things and make her own desserts and cakes in her house.  She has a lot of customers.  The reason that she requested the loan is to be able to rent a spot to be able to sell her cakes there.  She wants the people who go to the town of San Juan del Progresso to taste her cakes and come back to see her.  

She would like to use her earnings to make one of the best pastry shops in San José del Progreso.  She wants this in order to have a better quality of life for her and for the people who she loves the most.  That would be her husband, Pablo, and her children; Brenda, Miriam, Lourdes, and Gustavo.

The other 12 members of the group are:

María del Carmen-sells shoes
Elena –sells food
Catalina-to sell food
Bertha-to buy and sell clothes
Teodora-to buy materials to make tortillas
Fabiola-sells footwear
Celia- to sell clothes
Eleazar-will buy brickmaking materials
Manuel-will buy materials for the fields
Beatriz-to buy chicken
Brenda-to buy and sell shoes

All of the members of the José de las Juquilitas group give thanks to the team of workers at the Fundación Realidad for the support they have given them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastry.

loans.name: Bayarjavhlan

texts.en:
Bayarjavhlan is 25 years old and lives with her husband and son in an apartment in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is an inspector at an airport while her son who is one year old stays home. She manages a clothing trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to expand her business in the future. 

Now her working capital has reached 1,000,000 MNT. She is planning to increase her business sales in order to buy a plot of land where she can have a house for her family. She is a polite and kind woman who says, "I want to have my own store in the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 10.  In 2005, she established  her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to expand the inventory of her store.  

In the future, Laxmi plans to  expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

For a borrower to improve her living standard, extra training is needed. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called  "pasal", are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is married with one child. Hilario is 75 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Hilario sells goods  to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 4000 to purchase more different dried fish for her retail store.

Hilario has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail store

loans.name: Virgilo

texts.en:
Virgilio, 40 years old, married and he and his wife were blessed with four children. He's been growing corn for almost 18 years. His net income last planting season was 20,000 PHP. 

He's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm. He hopes to continue to access loans and achieve his dream for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm.

loans.name: Vieng

texts.en: Mrs. Vieng is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She sells some goods such as Khmer cakes and corn on the ferry dock, earning around US $2.50 each day. To share the financial expenses, her husband is employed as a casual construction worker. They have two children; one works as a hairdresser at a beauty salon, generating about $2.50 per day to contribute to the family's expenses. Mrs. Vieng will be using her loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband to ride to work as his existing one broke. She will use the balance of the loan to purchase extra cakes and corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
This is Petronila, 50, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gabriel, a driver, and mother of two children, one of whom is in college, while the other is in elementary school, a dream for most Filipino parents like Petronila, as she herself has been an undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Petronila operates a firewood and charcoal retailing business. In the Philippines, many still use the old ways of cooking (on an earthen stove where firewood is used) to save money. Firewood and charcoal is way cheaper than LPG fuel, which in the current market costs as much as Php 600, and a lot of people in the provinces prefer to buy firewood, which is so cheap that it can be bought for Php 20 a bundle. Petronila also earns by selling the firewood to suppliers who buy it in bulk. More people are also switching to firewood which can be foraged or found in the trash. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of wood and charcoal to rebundle and retail to her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Petronila dreams of being able to give both her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her family and community with her as she continues to serve the Lord Almighty through her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for new stock and products for her business.

loans.name: Dembereldavaa

texts.en: Dembereldavaa is 22 years old who lives with his mother and older sister in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His mother is retired while her older sister manages a clothing trading business. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2010. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides comfortable service for his customers. He is planning to have repair done for his car in order to provide safe drive for his customers. He is a hardworking young man who says, "I am planning to continue business in the future." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase new parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase to new parts for his car

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, 49, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a vendor. She has four children; all now have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Jesusa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jesusa earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 386 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jesusa hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with six children. Erlinda is 77 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Erlinda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. 

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato, 40 years old, is married and they were blessed with three children. Renato has been growing corn for almost 15 years. Last growing season his net income was 35,000 PHP. He's asking a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. 

Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his business and financial security.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
This is Renato, 40, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Rosa, a housewife, and is the father of four children. Three of them are studying, while the youngest is still a baby.  At this time, he is working hard to send his children to school.  Renato himself has been a college undergraduate, and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents cam leave to their children.

Renato operates a newspaper stand. In his business, he not only sells newspapers but candies as well, and has pocketbooks(paperback novels) for rent. He buys newspapers from the suppliers and sells them on the sidewalk. To make the newspaper stand a little different from the others, he buys pocketbooks to have them rented or traded. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php267 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to pay for newspaper delivery, new pocketbooks and other products that he can sell in his cart. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Renato dreams of being able to give all his children a good, high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of products he sells in his business

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is married, with 3 children. Pedrito is 51 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

Pedrito sells flowers and candles to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years.  Each month, he earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more candles and flowers for his retail business.  Pedrito has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more candles and flowers for his retail business

location.town: Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar is a widow who lives with her son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She manages a food market at a rented stall at a local market. With 3 years of business operations, she has been able to stabilize her business and is planning to expand it in the future. In addition, she operates a travel business at Terelj, one of the beautiful sites of Mongolia. 
Now her business is quite profitable, which allows her to contribute her earnings for the improvement of her living conditions. She is a hardworking lady who says, "Even though I have reached sixty, I am doing my best to help my son to lead a better life." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is married with 3 children.  She is 30 years old and lives in Clarin.

Lowela sells a variety of products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase a larger variety of products. Lowela has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of products

loans.name: Saruul-Erdene

texts.en:
Saruul-Erdene is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His older son is a disabled man who stays home all day. His younger two daughters are in secondary school, while the youngest one is in kindergarten. He manages an auto parts repair business with the help of his wife. His wife is responsible for the financial management part of their business operation. He attributes his business success to his wife's good accounting skills. He started his business 3 years ago after working as a driver and repairer for 22 years at a public transportation office. At first he used to have only tire repair, but then expanded into an auto parts repair business. With his earnings, he has been able to build his own workshop. 

The loan which he received from Xacbank, one of the biggest banks in Mongolia, helped him to expand and stabilize his business operation. Now he is one of the reliable and trusted loan recipients of Xacbank. He is a polite and kind man who says, "I must work hard, because my business earnings are the only source of income for my family. Now I have many regular customers who are happy with our service. I like to think that one can achieve success if he works hard to fulfill his dream." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan, 41 years old, is a humble mother who has three children who attend school. She is a domestic rice cultivator who has been planting rice on farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband works with her on the farm. Mrs. Chan also raises chickens for more income.

Mrs. Chan would like to request a loan for the rainy season planting and for breeding chickens. She and her family live in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province.

loans.use: to plant rice and to breed chickens.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: Batchuluun is 41 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Dornod province of Mongolia. Her older son is a student who helps with his mother's business during his vacation. She manages a clothing business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to expand her business in the future. Previously, she used to work at an ice-cream factory for several years and, because of a low salary, she had to quit her job. Now she sells all kinds of clothes, with a broad variety of design and style.  Her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I want my children to be educated and have better jobs in the future." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothes from China.

loans.use: to purchase clothes from China

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
Kimleang, 48 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a taxi driver.  Their income is about $7 per day.  They have 5 children who are 26, 24, 22, 19 and 17 years old. None of them are in school but are working instead. Each of them can make $4 per day. Every month, Kimleang has to spend $83 on food, $15 on electricity, $60 on a house rental fee, $60 on transportation and $60 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a vehicle to transport things from the garment factory. If she could buy a truck to start this new career for her husband, then he will make more income to support the family.

loans.use: to buy a truck to transport things from the garment factory

loans.name: Oyunerdene

texts.en:
Oyunerdene is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her daughter, who is 2 years old, attends kindergarten while her husband manages a taxi service in his town.  Oyundrdene manages a clothing business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in January, 2011. Now her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT, with daily earnings of 50,000-60,000 MNT. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I want to continue my business, because it is a source of income for my family. Also I would like to have a house for my family."

 She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
